commit_message:
Support correct lswitch update/add

When logical switch is read, compare to current value and only
change the object if any field changed, this reduce the number of
log printings to the screen

Change-Id: I0214a49ab44428a61da6317038f89ee4dbbd3a6c

commit_message:
Fix argument order for assertEqual to (expected, observed)

assertEqual expects that the arguments provided to it should be
(expected, observed).If a particluar order is kept as a convention,
then it helps to provide a cleaner message to the developer if Unit Tests
fail. There are several Unit Test files where the arguments for assertEqual
have been swapped. This commit fixes the issue in networking-midonet.

Change-Id: I00daee7e5628151e38d8becdfa7057c78aa48abe
Closes-Bug: #1259292

subject: Prevent DBError caused by wrong param passed to get_security_group
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-07 01:24:05.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/plugin.py'], 'message': "Prevent DBError caused by wrong param passed to get_security_group

Previously, in update_port() we would call _get_port() to get a copy
of the original port before we actually updated it. This original_port
value is in the form of a sqlalchemy object though and the method
update_security_group_on_port() uses the original port value to populate
update_port['security_groups'] I suppose to be helpful to the caller. In
our case, we'd later pass this value to get_security_groups and it would
give us an error of: DBError because we were passing a
neutron.db.securitygroups_db.SecurityGroupPortBinding rather than an id.

Change-Id: I04c522f6aed112dd3345f99ac80d582e667bab80
Closes-bug: #1514011
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Prevent DBError caused by wrong param passed to get_security_group

Previously, in update_port() we would call _get_port() to get a copy
of the original port before we actually updated it. This original_port
value is in the form of a sqlalchemy object though and the method
update_security_group_on_port() uses the original port value to populate
update_port['security_groups'] I suppose to be helpful to the caller. In
our case, we'd later pass this value to get_security_groups and it would
give us an error of: DBError because we were passing a
neutron.db.securitygroups_db.SecurityGroupPortBinding rather than an id.

Change-Id: I04c522f6aed112dd3345f99ac80d582e667bab80
Closes-bug: #1514011

subject: Add support for allowable network drivers configuration
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-09 20:53:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add support for allowable network drivers configuration

Problem:
Magnum should provide support for configuration of what
container network drivers are allowed, and this needs to
be supported on a per-COE basis.

With the changes proposed in
https://review.openstack.org/230147, the allowable
network drivers per COE are hardcoded. Magnum should
allow for a cloud operator to override these hardcoded,
allowed network drivers via configuration in
/etc/magnum/magnum.conf.

Proposed fix:
Add 3 configuration list options to the magnum.conf config:
- kubernetes_allowed_network_drivers
  (default=['flannel'])
- swarm_allowed_network_drivers
  (default=[])
- mesos_allowed_network_drivers
  (default=[])
Validation of the --network-driver attributes for a
baymodel create will be performed against this above
configuration on a per-COE basis.

Change-Id: Ibaa21d43fd6b5c1a6acc10e56145280eeaea8534
Closes-Bug: #1504635
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-20 16:36:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add support for allowable network drivers configuration

https://review.openstack.org/230147, the choices
of container network drivers that can be selected

These hard-coded selections will probably

commit_message:
Add support for allowable network drivers configuration

Problem:
With the changes that were merged with https://review.openstack.org/230147, the
choices of container network drivers that can be selected for a given COE type
when creating a Magnum baymodel are hardcoded, and are based on network drivers
that Magnum can support for each COE.

These hard-coded selections will probably make sense in most cases. However, in
some cloud instances, a cloud provider or cloud admin may want to restrict the
choices of network drivers that a user can select for a given COE even further,
based on specific restrictions in the cloud.

Magnum should provide support for configuration of what container network
drivers are allowed, and this needs to be provided on a per-COE basis.

Proposed fix:
Add 3 configuration list options to the config in /etc/magnum/magnum.conf for
configuring allowed nework drivers for kubernetes, swarm and mesos
respectively. The keyword 'all' can be used to allow all network drivers
supported by Magnum for that COE. The new config options are:
- kubernetes_allowed_network_drivers
  (default=['all'])
- swarm_allowed_network_drivers
  (default=['all'])
- mesos_allowed_network_drivers
  (default=['all'])
Validation of the --network-driver attributes for a baymodel create will be
performed against this above configuration on a per-COE basis.

Change-Id: Ibaa21d43fd6b5c1a6acc10e56145280eeaea8534
Closes-Bug: #1504635

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-26 21:17:23.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf'], 'message': "Fix usage of setUpClass method in functional tests

Class method 'setUpClass' is executed for each test of test suite that
appeared in new thread. It leads to creation of redundant resources,
and, hence, waste of resources.

So, add 'group_regex' option in testr config that will make all tests
of each class run in one thread.

Change-Id: I8100a98961791cee52b0866c7d593cc8371b3329
Closes-Bug: #1509460
(cherry picked from commit 7962533b94ae4abf48b3bdbc65564e7c1d6e6c7f)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of setUpClass method in functional tests

Class method 'setUpClass' is executed for each test of test suite that
appeared in new thread. It leads to creation of redundant resources,
and, hence, waste of resources.

So, add 'group_regex' option in testr config that will make all tests
of each class run in one thread.

Change-Id: I8100a98961791cee52b0866c7d593cc8371b3329
Closes-Bug: #1509460
(cherry picked from commit 7962533b94ae4abf48b3bdbc65564e7c1d6e6c7f)

commit_message:
Make string representation of DictModel generic

The previous version was specific to a port dict and would
fail if str() was called on other models. This iterates over
and logs all values of the dict instead so it works under any
dictionary.

Change-Id: I630b39338e4e67080e100a9f32c9b6e341a93472
Closes-Bug: #1512753

commit_message:
DNM: more debug logging for cells BDM race failure

We need more logging to know when we're creating BDMs, where we're
coming from when we hit the parent cell to update or create, and
if we're able to detect duplicates based on bdm source id (snapshot_id)
when the device_name isn't set.

Change-Id: I9378ee252ab4a19ed598a7e69df42db9d8c8153c
Related-Bug: #1489581

commit_message:
Remove manager-driver assignment metadata construct

The old kvs-inspired metadata construct was still hanging around
between the assignment manager and driver. This patch removes this
and re-uses other existing methods in its place.

Implements: blueprint remove-role-metadata

Change-Id: Ic7737fc44c1d1a86521c428216316d06b67dd1f9

Update minimum tox version to 1.8

Other projects have updated to 1.8 or later for the minimum
tox version (nova, neutron), so we should probably do the
same.

commit_message:
Brocade driver add_zone optimization

Check whether the new zone we want to add/create
has the same zone name and members with the existing
zone on the switch. If they are same, no need to
delete and re-add it. This is significant if we
create volume from image or upload volume to image
in batch.

Implements: blueprint brocade-add-zone-optimization
Change-Id: I257ec25fed9fab4b3a85a0f200c2ee426c8e6f8c

Delete the API guide

The API guide points to the "quick start" guide, so we can delete
the API guide in the api-site repository.

commit_message:
Add module_path column to datasource table

Only datasource_manager has a map between a datasource driver and
a path of the datasource class. Datasource_manager will be deleted
in the distributed architecture, so it enables API model classes to
get the map from congress DB.

Change-Id: I4d16e4b32a4aaf2916c65d70fd0bf07e82eefc79
Partially-Implements: blueprint dist-api-rpcify-schema

commit_message:
config reference for neutron (networking-zvm)

  As a workaround, networking-zvm can generate config reference
  by directory copying to neutron tree in source directory.
  
  This patch will be reverted after name space fixation
  in networking-zvm.

  currently name space header uses "neutron",
  This causes conflict with neutron itself.

Change-Id: Ia86eabf8c982431dbf6af727373349d3c2add1a9
Related-Bug: #1503967

Help for glance_api_servers option lacked information that it is
possible to specify protocol there (http or https) and suggested that
it isn't possible to use HTTPS in connection from Cinder to Glance.

commit_message:
Add protocol to help of glance_api_servers option

Help for glance_api_servers option lacked information that it is
possible to specify protocol there (http or https) and suggested that
it isn't possible to use HTTPS in connection from Cinder to Glance.
This commit expands the message to include such information.

Change-Id: I5afa33193b6dda2477e5a28fa042e625d449257b
Closes-Bug: 1509065

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-06 07:36:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Debug logs properly formate message

expected is only for the localization functions (_LI, _LW, _LE, _).  Since debug
logs do not use localization, they just need to do normal string formatting.  To keep
consistency with how other LOG messages format, the % operator is used.

commit_message:
Fix log message formatting that cause log errors

Log messages take *args for the format replacements instead of a
tuple.  This fixes the 2 that were using tuples.

Closes-Bug: #1513302
Change-Id: Idb3927427684d8a2e053543f76a5085a15753007

commit_message:
Swap out pyOpenSSL for cryptography in LocalCertGenerator

In certain cases (non-deterministic? maybe OS related?) the pyOpenSSL
bindings were not working properly, and since I was meaning to do
this eventually anyway, I just went ahead and did it now.

subject: Refactor dynamic types mapping feature to use importlib
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-05 20:34:00.000000000', 'files': ['translator/hot/translate_node_templates.py'], 'message': 'Refactor dynamic types mapping feature to use importlib

It was discovered that the Python imp.find_module() method behaves
differently on Mac environments. Sometimes it does not find the
specified module even if it does exist on the sys.path.

To fix this for all platforms, the code was refactored to use the
importlib.import_module() method. This module looks to correctly
work on both platforms, Linux and Mac OSX.

Change-Id: I521cd430dc04f60e44c192cb3194a0ae07efacb7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Refactor dynamic types mapping feature to use importlib

It was discovered that the Python imp.find_module() method behaves
differently on Mac environments. Sometimes it does not find the
specified module even if it does exist on the sys.path.

To fix this for all platforms, the code was refactored to use the
importlib.import_module() method. This module looks to correctly
work on both platforms, Linux and Mac OSX.

Change-Id: I521cd430dc04f60e44c192cb3194a0ae07efacb7

commit_message:
Set SERVICE_HOST, enable cache, install key, tempest and monasca only

Set SERVICE_HOT=192.168.10.6. When OpenStack services register with
Keystone, this will register using the IP address that is accessible
from the host OS.

Enable the vagrant-cachier to speed-up subsequent deploys.

Disable all OpenStack services except for mysql, rabbit, key and
monasca. This will reduce the size of the VM and speed-up
deploys.

Change-Id: I791cce4dbf3a7f1c2297fb288886aae35ada4658

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 17:21:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Deprecate local conductor mode

Way back when we started no-db-compute, we introduced the conductor service
and provided a "local mode" which made conductor's API layer a passthrough to
the manager and thus the database. This eliminated the need to move to
conductor for deployments that weren't ready or had other blockers.

Now, conductor is a pretty critical part of nova's infrastructure and
continuing to allow both modes invites issues (such as bug 1505471). This
patch starts the timer on deprecation for this mode of operation so that
we can remove it in the future.

Change-Id: Ifbd5578dcc53b2117674db2016e5d882a82866aa
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-05 18:13:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Deprecate local conductor mode

Now, conductor is a pretty critical part of nova's infrastructure and
continuing to allow both modes invites issues (such as bug 1505471). This
patch starts the timer on deprecation for this mode of operation so that
we can remove it in the future.

Change-Id: Ifbd5578dcc53b2117674db2016e5d882a82866aa

Now, conductor is a pretty critical part of nova's infrastructure and
continuing to allow both modes invites issues (such as bug 1505471). This
patch starts the timer on deprecation for this mode of operation so that
we can remove it in the future.

UpgradeImpact: A deployment mode is being deprecated and will require any
existing operators using this to deploy conductor before removal.

Change-Id: Ifbd5578dcc53b2117674db2016e5d882a82866aa', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Deprecate local conductor mode

Way back when we started no-db-compute, we introduced the conductor service
and provided a "local mode" which made conductor's API layer a passthrough to
the manager and thus the database. This eliminated the need to move to
conductor for deployments that weren't ready or had other blockers.

Now, conductor is a pretty critical part of nova's infrastructure and
continuing to allow both modes invites issues (such as bug 1505471). This
patch starts the timer on deprecation for this mode of operation so that
we can remove it in the future.

UpgradeImpact: A deployment mode is being deprecated and will require any
existing operators using this to deploy conductor before removal.

Change-Id: Ifbd5578dcc53b2117674db2016e5d882a82866aa

commit_message:
Replace python-keystoneclient with OSC

OpenStackClient is recommended to interact with
Keystone instead of python-keystoneclient now.
This patch replaces python-keystoneclient with
OpenStackClient.

Change-Id: I26e2c13a185fbe2aa993eb31bbeb4cad96f9bddb
Closes-Bug: #1512548

commit_message:
[spec] Improve and make pluggable type conversion

This proposes to make resource type converters into proper plugins,
stop depending on OpenStack as much as is possible without modifying
validation, and make some improvements to handle an edge case
converting images.

Change-Id: If078332230df417b3967f086815796c7a96fa882

commit_message:
Move update_fip_statuses to Router class

I noticed that ri.floating_ips was being accessed from the agent.  It
didn't seem right.  Also, noticed that this set gets passed around too
much between methods.  It all boils down to saving the previous set
and then doing set difference to see which ones went away.  This patch
set makes it simpler.

Partially-Implements: blueprint address-scopes

Change-Id: I73424620e196200c70f221871c34e33ccfe73261

commit_message:
Make '*' the default ml2 flat_networks configuration

Update the ml2 flat_networks configuration to set '*' as the
default because that has been effectively the default behavior due
to a bug with the empty list.

Also, fix the empty list configuration for disabling flat networks.

DocImpact
UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I13eb22afd7c0d011154b58a1bd218fd4fa82a8d9
Closes-bug: #1437745
Co-Authored-By: Martin Hickey <martin.hickey@ie.ibm.com>

subject: [WIP] Deploy multinode in gate
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-04 07:12:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[WIP] Deploy multinode in gate

This is very rough but gets the basic idea across for multinode in a
single node. Some points for reflection:

* sysctl breaks in the container due to missing /proc entries for some
  modules (in this case the bridge module)
* --pid=host launches the process in the same pid namespace as the
  docker daemon resides in, not the true host pid namespace
* The only way the containers can communicate is via L2 over a bridge
  on the host. This means packets must leave OVS module and traverse
  the kernel network stack (multinode from L2 perspective)
* BTRFS is saving the day here by skipping the registry push/pull

Change-Id: I0fcaac2e0cf5634aacd19c3b615ff5216b54160f
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate

commit_message:
[WIP] Deploy multinode in gate

This is very rough but gets the basic idea across for multinode in a
single node. Some points for reflection:

* sysctl breaks in the container due to missing /proc entries for some
  modules (in this case the bridge module)
* --pid=host launches the process in the same pid namespace as the
  docker daemon resides in, not the true host pid namespace
* The only way the containers can communicate is via L2 over a bridge
  on the host. This means packets must leave OVS module and traverse
  the kernel network stack (multinode from L2 perspective)
* BTRFS is saving the day here by skipping the registry push/pull

Change-Id: I0fcaac2e0cf5634aacd19c3b615ff5216b54160f
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate

subject: Enable 2-node gating for Kolla
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 00:43:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable 2-node gating for Kolla

This adds an experimental job for Kolla to take advantage of n-node
gating.

Change-Id: I9e326fcf0efbf530099bb6a58c59fa0151a0e2e4
Depends-On: I3e05e2d5c739794ae6ff0cc375dc6226f81bb542
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-06 00:46:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Enable 2-node gating for Kolla

commit_message:
Implement default host maintenance mode handling.

This patch implements a default host_maintenance_mode in compute.
It calls driver's corresponding API. If the driver has not implemented
one, it falls back to the default one.

The reason why doing this is: host maintenance mode handling could
be handled in compute and conductor. It doesn't have to fall into
driver level. Of cource, a driver could provide its own handling
using its special functionaries, e.g. Xen.

Change-Id: I4615d3965d992348afe91822e6f84c168d465dc2
Implements: blueprint host-maintenance-mode
Signed-off-by: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Add host_maintenance_mode() API to conductor.

This patch implements a host_maintenance_mode() in conductor.
It migrates all instances on the compute node, and run into
monitor waiting for all migrations finish.

The call trace looks like this:

nova-api
|-> compute-api: host_maintenance_mode()
    |-> compute-rpcapi: host_maintenance_mode()
        |-> compute-manager: host_maintenance_mode()
            |-> Libvirt driver: host_maintenance_mode() ---- Not implemented.
|-----------|
|           |-> Set host to maintenance mode.
|               (Waiting until migration monitor returns.)
V
conductor-api: host_maintenance_mode()
|-> conductor-rpcapi: host_maintenance_mode()
    |-> conductor-manager: host_maintenance_mode()
        |-> conductor-manager: migration_monitor()
        |   (Return when migration finishes.)
        |-> conductor-manager: migrate_server()
            |-> conductor-manager: _live_migrate()
                |-> task: _execute()
                    |-> task: _find_destination()
|-------------------|
V
compute-rpcapi: live_migration()
|-> compute-manager: live_migration()
    |-> compute-manager: live_migration().
        |-> thread: _do_live_migration()
            |-> libvirt driver: live_migration()
                |-> libvirt driver: _live_migration()
                    |-> thread: _live_migration_operation()
                    |-> libvirt driver: _live_migration_monitor()

Unit tests will be added in the next version if the implementation is OK.

Change-Id: I06707ebc8d437137952a7a7188f07e69a323f491
Implements: blueprint host-maintenance-mode
Signed-off-by: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Define Migration object in migrate_server() in conductor.

In the current code, Migration object is defined in _live_migrate().
But according to the previous patch, we need to pass Migration
objects to live migration monitor to check if the migrations are
successful in the end. So we make it a parameter of _live_migrate().
If not passed, we define one in _live_migration().

Unit tests will be added in the next version if this implementation is OK.

Change-Id: I2cd18b54833787d0b765969e2caccd5e2ddb4bea
Implements: blueprint host-maintenance-mode
Signed-off-by: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Implement a migration monitor in conductor.

Host maintenance mode means:
1. Disable compute service on the compute node.
2. Migrate all instances to other compute nodes.
3. Maintain the node (hardware or system upgrade).
4. Reenable compute service on the node.

If migrations fail, we should not set the host to maintenance mode
because the instances are still running on the host. So we need a
monitor to get the result of migrations.

This patch implements a simple migration monitor in conductor. It
takes a list of instances in migration status, checks their
migration_statuses every 1 section. If any of the migration failed,
the monitor returns False, and the caller decides what to do next.

PS: There are some problems in current usage of migration status.
    I have tried to fix them, but the BP won't be approved.
    (https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/live-migration-statuses)
    Will fix them in another way soon.

Change-Id: I903ace5b4a674f28b77e193a1554a8c9dc109643
Implements: blueprint host-maintenance-mode
Signed-off-by: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

This patch implements host_maintenance_mode() API in Libvirt driver.

In Libvirt driver, it enables/disables nova-compute service. And the real
call to realize_host_maintenance() API is implemented in host.py.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-23 08:28:16.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': 'Enable synchronous live migration in libvirt driver.

When putting host to maintenance mode, nova-compute service will be disabled
to prevent new instance created on this host. And then migrate all running
instances to other hosts. But the migration may fail. On failure, we have to
re-enable nova-compute service because we failed to put host to maintenance mode.

To do this, we must catch remote exception raised in migration flow. There are
two things need to do:
1. In compute-rpcapi, live_migration interface is called with cctxt.cast(), which
   is an asychronized method in oslo_messaging. It is unable to catch exceptions
   raised by remote hosts.
   To catch remote exception and re-raise it locally, we need to use cctxt.call().
2. In migration flow in Libvirt driver, the real work is done in a thread created
   with greenthread. We have to call greenthread.wait() to wait the thread finishes
   and catch exceptions raised in the thread.

If the above two things are done, the migration flow will become a synchronous call.
So this patch adds a new key:value pair "sync:True/False" to migrate_data parameter
in migration flow. It is used to control if the migration flow should be called
synchronously. Currently the only user of synchronous migration call is host
maintenance mode in Libvirt driver.

Change-Id: I392f97163d85569a09c2cb6d7eb1882e6bc806c2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Enable synchronous live migration in libvirt driver.

When putting host to maintenance mode, nova-compute service will be disabled
to prevent new instance created on this host. And then migrate all running
instances to other hosts. But the migration may fail. On failure, we have to
re-enable nova-compute service because we failed to put host to maintenance mode.

To do this, we must catch remote exception raised in migration flow. There are
two things need to do:
1. In compute-rpcapi, live_migration interface is called with cctxt.cast(), which
   is an asychronized method in oslo_messaging. It is unable to catch exceptions
   raised by remote hosts.
   To catch remote exception and re-raise it locally, we need to use cctxt.call().
2. In migration flow in Libvirt driver, the real work is done in a thread created
   with greenthread. We have to call greenthread.wait() to wait the thread finishes
   and catch exceptions raised in the thread.

If the above two things are done, the migration flow will become a synchronous call.
So this patch adds a new key:value pair "sync:True/False" to migrate_data parameter
in migration flow. It is used to control if the migration flow should be called
synchronously. Currently the only user of synchronous migration call is host
maintenance mode in Libvirt driver.

Change-Id: I392f97163d85569a09c2cb6d7eb1882e6bc806c2

commit_message:
Add realize_host_maintenance() API to compute.

According to the previous patch, host maintenance mode will work like this:
nova-api
|-> compute-api: host_maintenance_mode()
    |-> compute-rpcapi: host_maintenance_mode()
        |-> compute-manager: host_maintenance_mode()
            |-> Libvirt driver: host_maintenance_mode()
                                |
|-------------------------------|
V
compute-api: realize_host_maintenance()
|-> compute-rpcapi: realize_host_maintenance()
    |-> compute-manager: realize_host_maintenance()
        |-> conductor-api: realize_host_maintenance()
            |-> conductor-rpcapi: realize_host_maintenance()
                |-> conductor-manager: realize_host_maintenance()
                    |-> conductor-manager: migrate_server()

So this patch adds realize_host_maintenance() interface to nova-compute.

Change-Id: I1323d6afa73a5a2cf52449bbec557c918b22fa00

commit_message:
Add realize_host_maintenance() API to conductor.

This patch-set aims at implementing host maintenance mode in Libvirt driver.

When user inputs "nova host-update XXX --maintenance enable" command,
host maintenance mode works like this:
1. Disable nova-compute service in host XXX, so that nova-scheduler won't
   create new instance on that host.
2. Migrate all running instances to other hosts.
   (Ask nova-scheduler to pick up suitable hosts for the migration.)
3. Set the host to maintenance mode.

When user inputs "nova host-update XXX --maintenance disable" command,
host maintenance mode works like this:
1. Simply enable nova-compute service.

The command runs from nova-api level, through nova-compute, and then to the
Libvirt driver, like this:
nova-api
|-> compute-api
    |-> compute-rpcapi
        |-> compute-manage
            |-> Libvirt driver: host_maintenance_mode()

In order to call migration flow in nova-conductor, an interface needs to be
added to conductor. We name this interface as realize_host_maintenance().
It is going to be like this:
nova-api
|-> compute-api: host_maintenance_mode()
    |-> compute-rpcapi: host_maintenance_mode()
        |-> compute-manager: host_maintenance_mode()
            |-> Libvirt driver: host_maintenance_mode()
                                |
|-------------------------------|
V
compute-api: realize_host_maintenance()
|-> compute-rpcapi: realize_host_maintenance()
    |-> compute-manager: realize_host_maintenance()
        |-> conductor-api: realize_host_maintenance()
            |-> conductor-rpcapi: realize_host_maintenance()
                |-> conductor-manager: realize_host_maintenance()
                    |-> conductor-manager: migrate_server()

So this patch adds realize_host_maintenance() interface to nova-conductor.
It is the interface to call migration flow from host-update command.

Change-Id: Ic6da1e8592b5a084a527969e50eed8fadfa73649

commit_message:
Boot a vm on a shared public network by default

If there is a shared public network, tell nova to boot on it by default.
This works around the UI problem where if there is a public and a
private nova can't infer what you want to do. Also, allow specifying a
network by name and add a boolean to control the behavior. So that if
you want to boot private and you have a shared public network, it's as
easy as public=False, network=my-network-name.

Change-Id: I258d0a6330b8bce74e0db390a207ca307cef38da

commit_message:
Return volume_type extra specs based on policy

Currently extra specs are only shown to the admin user
when showing volume types. This patch grants the flexibility
to grant other users privelages to see them based on policy.

It also hides the extra_specs entry in the dictionary from
users who can't see it rather than just showing "None" as
the value.

Closes-Bug: #1504577
APIImpact

Change-Id: Ia8f71180f048ba9b253e35ee136915812ef8df0c

commit_message:
Adjust object_store to use upload/download names

object_store had been using create_object and save_object names, but
we've previously aggreed to use upload and download for those types of
calls.

Change-Id: I59a17cc29a989096820093ac7e6dba87c1f58b66
Partial-Bug: #1488631

commit_message:
Add doc tool chain

Various tox env are defined (borrowed from openstack-manuals),
The following are part of such tox envs:
- docs
- checkbuild
- checkniceness
- generatepot-rst

For mainly a testing purpose, contributor-guide/source/index.rst
includes CONTRIBUTING.rst at the top level.
To generate the current doc, run "tox -e checkbuild".

Change-Id: I5eb67c4d75fcbfba766c87664d0d0a33e7b89029

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-05 23:35:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_block_device.py', 'nova/objects/block_device.py'], 'message': "cells: create bdm at top if device_name is set for first time in save()

There is currently a race in test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot which
does the following:

1. Create a volume.
2. Boot a server instance using that volume.
3. Snapshot the volume-backed server instance.
4. Boot a second server from the snapshot image.

The second server boot fails because the snapshot image has duplicate
BDM snapshot entries with the same boot_index in it's metadata. This is
because there is a race on the initial server boot from volume where
cells_api.bdm_update_or_create_at_top is called in quick succession. Both
come from BlockDeviceMapping.save(). One comes from the compute manager when
prepping block devices during the instance build, and one from the virt layer
when the libvirt driver code nulls out the device_name on the BDM and saves
that off to the database. bdm_update_or_create_at_top is racing to update the
first BDM and ends up creating a second BDM instead, which then ends up
being turned into two volume snapshots in step 3 above.

So the root issue is the race in bdm_update_or_create_at_top and knowing when
we should be doing an insert versus an update. We should be able to determine
this based on when the device_name is set on the BDM rather than simply being
changed.

This adds bdm_field_is_new() to BlockDeviceMapping which lets us see if
a field has been newly set, as opposed to just changed. If it's the first time
device_name is set and we save(), we assume it's a first create and we insert,
else we do a DB update.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dms@danplanet.com>

Closes-Bug: #1489581

Change-Id: Ifb66602ea7977984480f6de6a285d632cf0d688a
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
cells: create bdm at top if device_name is set for first time in save()

There is currently a race in test_create_ebs_image_and_check_boot which
does the following:

1. Create a volume.
2. Boot a server instance using that volume.
3. Snapshot the volume-backed server instance.
4. Boot a second server from the snapshot image.

The second server boot fails because the snapshot image has duplicate
BDM snapshot entries with the same boot_index in it's metadata. This is
because there is a race on the initial server boot from volume where
cells_api.bdm_update_or_create_at_top is called in quick succession. Both
come from BlockDeviceMapping.save(). One comes from the compute manager when
prepping block devices during the instance build, and one from the virt layer
when the libvirt driver code nulls out the device_name on the BDM and saves
that off to the database. bdm_update_or_create_at_top is racing to update the
first BDM and ends up creating a second BDM instead, which then ends up
being turned into two volume snapshots in step 3 above.

So the root issue is the race in bdm_update_or_create_at_top and knowing when
we should be doing an insert versus an update. We should be able to determine
this based on when the device_name is set on the BDM rather than simply being
changed.

This adds bdm_field_is_new() to BlockDeviceMapping which lets us see if
a field has been newly set, as opposed to just changed. If it's the first time
device_name is set and we save(), we assume it's a first create and we insert,
else we do a DB update.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dms@danplanet.com>

Closes-Bug: #1489581

Change-Id: Ifb66602ea7977984480f6de6a285d632cf0d688a

', 'number': 17}, {'created': '2015-07-13 03:01:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Nested Quota Driver: Adding v2 and v3(v2.1) support

This patch provides v2 and v3(v2.1) support for Quota API calls.

NestedQuotaDriver is supposed to become the default quota driver
of Nova and it can handle nested as well as non-nested projects.
It is a superset of DbQuotaDriver.But to avoid any potential risks,
it is proposed as an optional driver in the first release.

Change-Id: Icc480e4f36374275b65c05fb1879074f57e9b1c3
Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

commit_message:
Nested Quota Driver: Adding v2 and v3 support

This patch provides v2 and v3 support for Nested Quota API calls.
Even after  these functionalites are added, the existing
functionalities remain unchanged while using DbQuotaDriver.

NestedQuotaDriver is supposed to become the default quota driver
of Nova and it can handle nested as well as non-nested projects.
It is a superset of DbQuotaDriver, which can replace it.
But to avoid any potential risks, NestedQuotaDriver is
proposed as an optional driver in the first release.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Icc480e4f36374275b65c05fb1879074f57e9b1c3
Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

commit_message:
Fix the clouds.yaml issue for the stable/liberty dsvm tests

Devstack in stable/liberty does not copy the clouds.yaml file to /etc
so we need to manually workaround this for the stable/liberty gate to
work correctly.

Change-Id: If72ea960f6479e73234ec0cf1af10687f172b86b

commit_message:
Nested Quota Driver: Finding parent_id and immediate child list

This patch adds two helper methods for finding the ID of the
parent project and the immediate child list of a project.
These methods are used for many important purposes like,
checking whether a project is root project, updating the
allocated quota etc.

NestedQuotaDriver is supposed to become the default quota driver
of Nova and it can handle nested as well as non-nested projects.
It is a superset of DbQuotaDriver.But to avoid any potential risks,
it is proposed as an optional driver in the first release.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Ide4dbbe36100b71588992e8469a436a3c4806c3a
Partially Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

commit_message:
NestedQuotaDriver:Modification of settable quotas of nested projects

In case of hierarchical projects, the settable quotas of projects
and users are changed.It will remain unchanged if DbQuotaDriver
is being used.When NestedQuotaDriver is used, allocated quota is
also considered while determining maximum and minimum quota

NestedQuotaDriver is supposed to become the default quota driver
of Nova and it can handle nested as well as non-nested projects.
It is a superset of DbQuotaDriver.But to avoid any potential risks,
it is proposed as an optional driver in the first release.

Change-Id: I1a4c7dd5f272328fe37e45e18cb0b644c3b51689
Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>

', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-02-01 13:56:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Setting of default values of resources to zero.

The sum of hard_limit of child projects should be less than or
equal to the free quota of the parent.
So, the default values of resources are set to zero to avoid race condition while multiple child projects tries to have default quota.

', 'number': 11}, {'created': '2015-05-12 01:22:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Setting the default values of resources to zero.

In nested projects, having finite default quota values is not relevant 
since the quota(hard_limit) of child project is determined
by the free quota of the parent.

The sum of hard_limit of child projects should be less than or
equal to the free quota of the parent.So, the default values of
resources are set to zero to avoid race condition while multiple
child projects try to have default quota.

Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>

Change-Id: I2af40e4ab841564105f6726650a1cd7e6e0f1980
Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api
', 'number': 12}, {'created': '2015-05-13 01:03:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Setting the default values of resources to zero.

In nested projects, having finite default quota values is not relevant
since the quota(hard_limit) of child project is determined
by the free quota of the parent.

The sum of hard_limit of child projects should be less than or
equal to the free quota of the parent.So, the default values of
resources are set to zero to avoid race condition while multiple
child projects try to have default quota.

Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api
', 'number': 13}, {'created': '2015-07-10 01:31:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Nested Quota Driver: Set default values to subproject and users.

In case of hierarchical projects, the default quota value of resources
in sub-projects and users in it are set to zero.This patch adds
this functionality for hierarchical projects, while keeping the
functionality intact for non-hierarchical projects.

Root projects and the users inside it will be having finite default
resource values, and so proper backward compatibility is ensured.If
any organisation, chooses not to have heierarchical projects,
NestedQuotaDriver will work extacly like DbQuotaDriver.

NestedQuotaDriver is supposed to become the default quota driver
of Nova and it can handle nested as well as non-nested projects.
It is a superset of DbQuotaDriver.But to avoid any potential risks,
it is proposed as an optional driver in the first release.

Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>

Change-Id: I2af40e4ab841564105f6726650a1cd7e6e0f1980

resource values, and so proper backward compatibility is ensured.If
any organisation, chooses not to have heierarchical projects,
NestedQuotaDriver will work extacly like DbQuotaDriver.

of Nova and it can handle nested as well as non-nested projects.
It is a superset of DbQuotaDriver.But to avoid any potential risks,
it is proposed as an optional driver in the first release.

commit_message:
NestedQuotaDriver: Set default values to sub-projects and users.

In case of hierarchical projects, the default quota value of resources
in sub-projects and users in it are set to zero.This patch adds
this functionality for hierarchical projects, while keeping the
functionality intact for non-hierarchical projects.

Root projects and the users inside it will be having finite default
resource values, and so proper backward compatibility is ensured.If
any organisation, chooses not to have heierarchical projects,
NestedQuotaDriver will work exactly like DbQuotaDriver.

NestedQuotaDriver is supposed to become the default quota driver
of Nova and it can handle nested as well as non-nested projects.
It is a superset of DbQuotaDriver.But to avoid any potential risks,
it is proposed as an optional driver in the first release.

Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>

Change-Id: I2af40e4ab841564105f6726650a1cd7e6e0f1980
Partially Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

range of port.

Octavia doesn't have hacking rules to check "assert" usages like:

- assertTrue(isinstance(A, class A))
- assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A)
- assertEquall(False, A) or assertEqual(True, A)
- assertEqual(a in b, True) or assertEqual(a in b, False)

This patch introduce hacking rules just above.

commit_message:
Set Hacking rules to check some tests assert

Octavia doesn't have hacking rules to check "assert" usages like:

- assertTrue(isinstance(A, class A))
- assertEqual(A, None) or assertEqual(None, A)
- assertEqual(False, A) or assertEqual(True, A)
- assertEqual(a in b, True) or assertEqual(a in b, False)

This patch introduce hacking rules just above.

Change-Id: If64402508226608b5700c8bb11e924dbc778fec3
Closes-Bug: #1511368

Oslo messaging RPCServers should not be launched to receive messages by calling
the wait method.  The wait method is meant to be called after stop to finish

commit_message:
Launch consumer without calling oslo messaging wait

Oslo messaging RPCServers should not be launched to receive messages by calling
the wait method.  The wait method is meant to be called after stop to finish
processing messages that were on the queue before the stop method was called.
Instead this uses oslo_service to launch the RPCServer.

Change-Id: I5aa4b0f349b26b523bd9853f2a2cd239c2991ea9
Closes-Bug: #1513689

When you request the token by using the POST method with 'V3/auth/tokens' the path,
and the request body includes a payload of credentials including the authentication
method and, optionally, the authorization scope,(The scope includes either a project or domain.)
and if everything is ok, the response you get, which should contain the metadata of 'extras'.
(Just like '"extras":""',in json format.)

Now, in the given examples of V3/auth/tokens, they have no the metadata of "extras", which contain
the extended information. In the code, we could see the information of 'extras'.

So, TokenAuthNoScopeResponse.json, TokenAuthScopeDomainResponse.json,
and TokenAuthScopeProjectResponse.json shold be updated.

commit_message:
Update the auth responses for identity-api/src/v3/samples

Adds "extras" and "audit_ids" missing response fields.

To request a token, issue the POST method with 'V3/auth/tokens' the path.

The response includes 'extras' metadata and audit_ids.

Updated TokenAuthNoScopeResponse.json, TokenAuthScopeDomainResponse.json,
TokenAuthScopeProjectResponse.json. Updated TokenAuthTokenRequest.json
and added TokenAuthTokenResponse.json.

Change-Id: I9978d0c8cb690545df54a249ecd84b286ee7cddc

commit_message:
Deprecate new= argument from create_connection

It's not used since the time we switched to oslo.messaging (Juno), it's
time to deprecate and eventually remove it.

Closes-Bug: #1506492
Change-Id: I57b0229c2b6028796cd10bbbfc9b166cf8a6dab0

commit_message:
Allow specifying a kazoo async handler 'kind'

In situations where the built-in (and default) kazoo
threading async handler does not work (which sometimes
appears to happen under eventlet) allow for specifying
a different handler (ie the 'eventlet' one) that should
work better under those scenarios.

Closes-bug: #1512001
Change-Id: Iec5e39928b223a3ffca0b9b5b4d0fd61abaa0f2b
(cherry-picked from commit 9c5cb6fd0ba6b08fd163130a8862137277e48020)

commit_message:
Port test_tintri to Python 3

* Set configuration.nfs_oversub_ratio, otherwise tests
  fail with TypeError on comparison between mock.Mock and int.
* tox.ini: add test_tintri to Python 3.4.

Change-Id: Ie2b5215795481bdfb11116876d83ef777a10c224
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3

subject: Add missing docs for ring.builder.rebalance
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 01:41:53.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/builder.py'], 'message': "Add missing docs for ring.builder.rebalance

commit 71993d84e88cc1d5f7742182905cace21c7e88cb added
a new 'remove_dev' column to the
swift.common.ring.builder.rebalance return value.

This patch adds the docs for that and clean up a bit to

Change-Id: Idfd46e47b9f6894cbafc8b7701a4c7414212f79f

commit_message:
Add missing docs for ring.builder.rebalance

commit 71993d84e88cc1d5f7742182905cace21c7e88cb added
a new 'remove_dev' column to the
swift.common.ring.builder.rebalance return value.

This patch adds the docs for that and clean up a bit to
the variable name to be easy to read.

Change-Id: Idfd46e47b9f6894cbafc8b7701a4c7414212f79f

commit_message:
Move evaluator tests into the unit folder

The evaluator tests are not run since we split functional and unit
tests.

This change moves them into unit folder to be ran again.

Related bug: #1513738

commit_message:
Implement all-in-one.sh script

This script will help newcomers to run this script and deploy a simple
scenario of an OpenStack Cloud with Puppet OpenStack modules.

commit_message:
Re-organise ssync tests

We have some tests that exercise both the sender and receiver,
but are spread across test_ssync_sender.py and test_ssync_receiver.py.
This creates a new module test_ssync.py and moves the end-to-end tests
into there.

Change-Id: Iea3e9932734924453f7241432afda90abbc75c06

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 13:35:22.000000000', 'files': ['rally/common/version.py'], 'message': 'Display correct version

`rally --version` displays correct version only on releases.
For release X+N patch, `rally --version` prints X+1 version, which is wrong(
since there is no X+1 release).

This patch changes displayed version to debian format:
 - <release_number> for releases
 - <last_release+1>~dev<number_of_patches_from_last_release> for development
   branch.

Change-Id: I53b1da26096172c0d7ccd275c9b3aff334bf569c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Display correct version

`rally --version` displays correct version only on releases.
For release X+N patch, `rally --version` prints X+1 version, which is wrong(
since there is no X+1 release).

This patch changes displayed version to debian format:
 - <release_number> for releases
 - <last_release+1>~dev<number_of_patches_from_last_release> for development
   branch.

Change-Id: I53b1da26096172c0d7ccd275c9b3aff334bf569c

commit_message:
Port manage/unmanage extensions to core API

Changes:
- Register manage/unmanage API extension as core API using old links.
- Remove extensions code.
- Leave rename of API urls for future update which will be done with
  bump of microversion after port of all extensions to core API.

Partially implements bp ext-to-core

Change-Id: I773398f13f4b3e4637599cb482a5a2c189958656

commit_message:
Update Octavias Operator API Docs

This patch is to update the octavia operator api doc
(http://docs.openstack.org/developer/octavia/main/octaviaapi.html),
 in this patch we updated the requests and responses content
for each section, such as lb, listener and etc.

Change-Id: Id0f734cb900b3f5e812849ff73e6ca97a8add8eb

commit_message:
Define entry points for filter factories for Paste Deployment

Define filter factories so projects can reference them by name
and can take advantage of the python egg instead of referencing
by the direct path.

Change-Id: I555ca5e4ae6bd89775d8ef95940b6915f4cef4da
Closes-Bug: #1505407

subject: remove gratuitous python packages
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-06 16:50:32.000000000', 'files': ['files/debs/general', 'files/debs/keystone', 'files/debs/nova', 'files/debs/n-novnc'], 'message': "remove gratuitous python packages

With pip + upper-constraints we're nearly always over installing all
python packages because we no longer support a range, we support
*exactly* one version.

This removes a bunch of the gratuitous package installs which we're
going to install over, lxml, numpy, libvirt. All of these we had
coming from packages in the past for speed concerns, but upper
constraints removes that.

It also ensures that all the headers to build all those are in
general, so they are guarunteed available at all times.

Change-Id: Ia76de730d65c84d81c4fb2c980ae1b4d595f9f5b
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
remove gratuitous python packages

With pip + upper-constraints we're nearly always over installing all
python packages because we no longer support a range, we support
*exactly* one version.

This removes a bunch of the gratuitous package installs which we're
going to install over, lxml, numpy, libvirt. All of these we had
coming from packages in the past for speed concerns, but upper
constraints removes that.

It also ensures that all the headers to build all those are in
general, so they are guarunteed available at all times.

Change-Id: Ia76de730d65c84d81c4fb2c980ae1b4d595f9f5b

The list_cnas() method is logging via the pypowervm log_helper
each time a VM is not found. This can generate a lot of

Change-Id: Id2f5c114838da293ec2ed3ae38a65c72633f57f6

commit_message:
Remove log_helper in list_cnas

The list_cnas() method is logging via the pypowervm log_helper
each time a VM is not found. This can generate a lot of
unnecessary logging.  This change removes the logger for
this method only as it's just listing the CNAs for the VM.

Change-Id: Id2f5c114838da293ec2ed3ae38a65c72633f57f6
(cherry picked from commit a4a9a3bb388b2528cf86e0806733cd1d36ad8b9c)

[{'created': '2015-10-16 03:48:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'NetApp: Cleanup if E-Series volume create fails

The creation of a volume may fail in such a manner
that a volume in a partial state has been created.
When Openstack comes back re-attempting the creation
operation it fails because the partial volume with
the name already exists.

Solution: When there is a failure creating a volume,
check if a partial volume was created and delete it
so any retry will be successful and the storage device
does not contain any dead volumes.

Change-Id: Id93527a4cab314f27a13d8c08b772fed538d1092

commit_message:
NetApp: Cleanup if E-Series volume create fails

The creation of a volume may fail in such a manner
that a volume in a partial state has been created.
When Openstack comes back re-attempting the creation
operation it fails because the partial volume with
the name already exists.

Solution: When there is a failure creating a volume,
check if a partial volume was created and delete it
so any retry will be successful and the storage device
does not contain any dead volumes.

Closes-Bug: 1506940
Change-Id: Id93527a4cab314f27a13d8c08b772fed538d1092

commit_message:
Allow IP addresses in IP ranges to be equal

* Update JSON-schema 'base_types.IP_ADDRESS_RANGE' to allow non-unique items.
* Add corresponding unit tests.

Change-Id: I0d9bfb11c0fa69874223ea451ee49f473040ba53
Closes-bug: #1513774

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-02 09:12:41.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/common/validators.py', 'barbican/tests/common/test_validators.py'], 'message': "Allow null content type for orders

For both symmetric [1] and assymetric [2] orders the content type
is defaulted to 'application/octet-stream'. On the other hand, for
certificates the value is completely ignored. Based on the previous two
facts, we can pass null values for the content type via the API, as we
had discussed a couple of cycles ago. Thus expecting Barbican's defaults
to act appropriately.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/tasks/resources.py#L285
[2] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/tasks/resources.py#L295

Change-Id: I98a558862eed039ed6f33fbee474bdb86767313e
Related-bug: #1425667
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow null content type for orders

For both symmetric [1] and assymetric [2] orders the content type
is defaulted to 'application/octet-stream'. On the other hand, for
certificates the value is completely ignored. Based on the previous two
facts, we can pass null values for the content type via the API, as we
had discussed a couple of cycles ago. Thus expecting Barbican's defaults
to act appropriately.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/tasks/resources.py#L285
[2] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/tasks/resources.py#L295

Change-Id: I98a558862eed039ed6f33fbee474bdb86767313e
Related-bug: #1425667

commit_message:
Allow null values for secret names

This secret allows null values for names in secrets as discussed a
couple of cycles back.

Since the code for the mocked client in the functional tests actually
filters out null values, it is currently not possible to write a
functional test for this in this functional test code base. However, it
will be written as part of the python-barbicanclient functional test
suite.

Change-Id: I68330d1d1b13e1bbb6436ca4f6684a76af3babd3
Related-bug: #1425667
Related-bug: #1376469

commit_message:
Switch to RDO untested master repository

RDO does not yet provide a CI tested Mitaka repository.
As such, the current-passed-ci repository is the last tested
repository before the stable/liberty branch was cut.

To be able to test against the latest packages, we need to
use the untested repositories until the CI tested repository
is in place.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I4a125eb3c84fa790746a9a8eca19e4fb2d9ecf38

subject: Fixes issues with oslo.messaging in consumer for stop and wait

[{'created': '2015-11-06 20:32:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixes issues with oslo.messaging in consumer for stop and wait

With the recent updates to the oslo.messaing, it wont let the
wait() to be called witout calling stop() first for any server.
This was done to make sure that oslo.messaging apis are not used
wrongly. Since wait() must be only used for waiting to clear
up all the messages once stop() is being called. If wait()
is called without stop() it throws warnings every second

commit_message:
Fixes issues with oslo.messaging in consumer for stop and wait

With the recent updates to the oslo.messaing, it wont let the
wait() to be called witout calling stop() first for any server.
This was done to make sure that oslo.messaging apis are not used
wrongly. Since wait() must be only used for waiting to clear
up all the messages once stop() is being called. If wait()
is called without stop() it throws warnings every second

Change-Id: I3b29859257475e3a98b4aaa4abdd9e0e425b458c
Closes-bug:1513670

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-21 08:45:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename project networking-bagpipe(-l2)

The networking-bagpipe-l2 project needs to be renamed
to reflect the fact that its scope encompasses more than just
a driver for Neutron L2 networks. The scope includes agent
extensions for BGPVPN interconnection, and will extend to Neutron
L3 and service-chaining.

The renaming consists in simply removing "-l2" from the name.

One thing is not addressed by this change: renaming the
corresponding launchpad project, which will be done as a
separate step.

Change-Id: I7774b9e9eb830c9320b361b78ebb0dbde3f97205
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-02 14:21:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Rename project networking-bagpipe(-l2)

The networking-bagpipe-l2 project needs to be renamed
to reflect the fact that its scope encompasses more than just
a driver for Neutron L2 networks. The scope includes agent
extensions for BGPVPN interconnection, and will extend to Neutron
L3 and service-chaining.

The renaming consists in simply removing "-l2" from the name.

The group statement in gerrit/projects.yaml is not needed anymore,

commit_message:
Rename project networking-bagpipe(-l2)

The networking-bagpipe-l2 project needs to be renamed
to reflect the fact that its scope encompasses more than just
a driver for Neutron L2 networks. The scope includes agent
extensions for BGPVPN interconnection, and will extend to Neutron
L3 and service-chaining.

The renaming consists in simply removing "-l2" from the name.

The group statement in gerrit/projects.yaml is not needed anymore,
because the LP project has been removed to drop "-l2" and
add 'networking-" so that LP and Openstack project are now identical.

This change also updates the gerrit ACLs for networking-bagpipe
to match the access list of a neutron stadium project.

Change-Id: I7774b9e9eb830c9320b361b78ebb0dbde3f97205

[{'created': '2015-10-02 13:06:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Rename puppet project 'puppet-openstack_health'

This commit renames the module to be 'puppet-openstack_health'.

As Spencer Krum (nibalizer) pointed out at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227849/
this project is not following the naming conventions for puppet modules.

This has a major impact on install_modules.sh, which will not be able to clone and
install this module appropriately.

As part of this, we will need to schedule a maintenance window to take down
gerrit, zuul, etc. and follow the steps enumerated at:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/gerrit.html#renaming-a-project

commit_message:
Rename puppet project 'puppet-openstack_health'

This commit renames the module to be 'puppet-openstack_health'.

As Spencer Krum (nibalizer) pointed out at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227849/
this project is not following the naming conventions for puppet modules.

This has a major impact on install_modules.sh, which will not be able to clone and
install this module appropriately.

As part of this, we will need to schedule a maintenance window to take down
gerrit, zuul, etc. and follow the steps enumerated at:
http://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/gerrit.html#renaming-a-project

Change-Id: I10c0b61268179088496fe3c381ebd17935cc9e69
Co-Authored-By: Caio Carrara <ccarrara@thoughtworks.com>

commit_message:
Rename projects akanda-* -> astara-*

The project-formely-known as Akanda has moved to openstack/ and is to be
renamed Astara. This is the final phase of the project move+rename.

This patch renames:

    - openstack/akanda-rug -> openstack/astara
    - openstack/akanda-appliance -> openstack/astara-appliance
    - openstack/akanda-horizon -> openstack/astara-horizon
    - openstatck/akanda-neutron -> openstack/astara-neutron

It also renames gerrit groups:
    - akanda-core -> astara-core
    - akanda-release -> astara-release

As part of the rename, it also retires two unused repos to openstack-attic:

    - akanda
    - akanda-appliance-builder

Jenkins jobs and zuul layouts updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I3d64946d00cf7fd9c8dce725c56b83e256a6fd11

commit_message:
Add multi-initiator extra-spec for Nimble driver

This patch allows setting up multi-initiator access for
the Nimble driver through the extra-specs.

This can be set by adding the key 'nimble:multi-initiator'
with boolean value of 'true' or 'false'. If nothing is
specified it defaults to 'false'.

Change-Id: Iade49f0ce418a2db7ea9a00ebf925a017e3eb429
Closes-Bug: #1495750
(cherry picked from commit 594a1a6687f514885744384ca147411433186fa1)

commit_message:
On py3, use dnspython3 dependency, not dnspython

Update requirements to install dnspython3 on Python 3 and dnspython on
Python 2. dnspython is not compatible with Python 3, and dnspython3
is not compatible with Python 2.

Add a requirement on pbr to ensure that pbr 1.6 or newer is
installed. pbr 1.0 or newer is required to support environment
markers in requirements which are now used to select dnspython or
dnspython3 depending on the Python major version.

Note: pbr 1.0 is enough, but OpenStack global requirements asks to
use "pbr>=1.6".

Change-Id: Ie5d437cd396972d4143ffffb96ec3c289e221b08

commit_message:
Set IPSec site connection Down if peer doesn't respond

If OpenSwan or LibreSwan driver is used then when one of the peer
connections goes down by any reason the second connection remains
in 'Active' state, though it is incorrect. StrongSwan driver
doesn't have such problem.

This change modifies ipsec site connection status check for
OpenSwan and LibreSwan drivers in the following way:
If a status check shows that a given pluto process is still running,
scan output related to all its connections and mark 'Down' those,
for which there is no established IPSec SA.

Refactored UT so that connection status tests are executed for all
*Swan drivers, which involved changing base class of OpenSwanProcess
tests to IPSecDeviceLegacy.

Closes-Bug: #1487003
Change-Id: I699c71a92ec33dd8ccfc31098299d019b11dfe9a

commit_message:
Bump UCA & RDO to Liberty GA

* Bump from Kilo to Liberty by default for RDO repository, Debian and
  UCA.
* Update GPG KEY files

Change-Id: I709ae10101b7156a60efc10e88866abe3e643417

Added created_at in the output of solum app cmds

solum app list and solum app show now show the created_at attribute
too.

commit_message:
Fix interface selection to be automatic

Added a list of possible interfaces for which the
vagrant provisioner will choose the first one that
is available.  No more editing the test recipes.

Cleaned up the os selection to hide the
version specific stuff to be consistent with the
environment logic.

Fixed up some file modes.

Forced the chef client config directory as it can search
in bad places in some scenarios.

Change-Id: I38a7a86b58893b912af99fabf04ca9052f914346

commit_message:
Make RHEL build properly

build.py -b rhel -t [rdo|rhos|source|binary]

The last patch for this didn't quite fix the problem properly as
it only permitted RHOS builds.

backport: liberty

Change-Id: I27eed202560adce450c07d043cc224e7a6c6bbf6
Closes-Bug: #1513088
(cherry picked from commit 5eb15d2e4a9b41a88984ad7769c5c473e56dc89c)

commit_message:
Fix RHEL builds

Register with RHEL on the host machine and use yum to setup
the repos in the container.

Change-Id: I38aaf43fffaf7a235e69b330d5d9f0f1be31fe83
Backport: Liberty
Closes-Bug: #1513088
(cherry picked from commit 0340bc4043bd65fbc975c11a86ba89e20293be0a)

commit_message:
Update dnsmasq to setup dhcp when Admin networks are changed

When parameters of any Admin network are changed or Admin network is
deleted new UpdateDnsmasq task is called to setup dnsmasq with new
configuration for dhcp.

Co-Authored-By: Aleksei Kasatkin <akasatkin@mirantis.com>

Partial-Bug: #1495593

Change-Id: I532f21508c78bd142fbd0aa1754bcb7b617b121b

commit_message:
Add retry and delay to RabbitMQ queue mirroring setup.

Occasionally, RabbitMQ will not be fully up before trying to setup queue
mirroring. This change adds a retry with delay to the task to help coax
it into being successful.

Change-Id: Ifee971176dc9649131778f7fe2fe16144509a1b1
Closes-bug: #1513668

commit_message:
Support to get hardware's cpu_util from snmp

Now, agent-central can only get cpu load, this patch add cpu_util
definition to snmp.yaml so that agent-central is able to  get
hardware's cpu_util metric.

Closes-Bug: #1513731
Change-Id: Ia43c4f103476567c607b63493261f1508dd19f5a

[{'created': '2015-10-30 18:02:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Replace calls to 'oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime()'

The aformentioned library function has been deprecated and will be
removed in a future release. Replace all calls to this function and
therefore resolve the deprecation warnings that are shown.

commit_message:
Replace calls to 'oslo_utils.timeutils.strtime()'

The aformentioned library function has been deprecated and will be
removed in a future release. Replace all calls to this function and
therefore resolve the deprecation warnings that are shown.

Partial-Bug: #1479056
Change-Id: Id6431d04e87da8344196d2d1a216b414b2dd9208

commit_message:
Connecting app logs to workflow

Changing the solumclient to get logs from workflow resource
instead of assembly resource.

Change-Id: Idf899d99bf5cd71128304446035107ab6f6d4f0f
Closes-Bug: #1498181

commit_message:
Bugfix release for os-client-config

A bug crept in to the 0.10.0 release where cache timing numbers started
being returned as strings. This corrects that. It also adds a workaround
for keystoneclient bug#1513839

Change-Id: I3f785865f0deda1ff0c529107a0cac4442c22259

commit_message:
Make name_matches_object accept list of objects

This makes it easier and more efficient to check randomly-generated
names against multiple objects to see if they could have been
generated by any of the given objects.

Implements blueprint: consistent-resource-names
Change-Id: I0c7b7bc9bd65738984bf5b156a6c249756aaf4fe

commit_message:
Replace require.js loader/r.js builder with webpack

Webpack is much more powerful than r.js and opens path
to further improvements in testing, build speed,
developer convenience, ES2015, etc.

Implements blueprint webpack

Change-Id: I18a3b74db243f29e5dacb004569d66463f4ab16d

commit_message:
Update import oslo_serialization/utils for config-ref generation

The fixation of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236769/
is not enough for config-ref generation.
This patch intends to update
import oslo_serialization
       oslo_utils
for config-ref generation

Change-Id: If79c0ac3b81016b8447266e890452ddf83c195f4
Related-Bug: #1503967

commit_message:
Controlled logging from nailgun

This commit adds functionality to control logging from nailgun
by APP_LOGLEVEL value in the '/etc/nailgun/settings.yaml'

Also it adds ability to change log level value via puppet manifests.

Change-Id: I9d2ff84df1d663be363d2f1f7dc7d5e141bfdf27
Closes-Bug: #1510151

commit_message:
Fix to disable meter-links on resource-list CLI

This adds an optional param to resource-list
CLI to disable meter-links. By default its
False to generate meter links for backward
compatibility.

This is a cherry-pick from master patch that
enables meter-links on resource-list CLI.

Change-Id: I308b94c8a57833cf30b4815ecec2ff9a50e91af6
Closes-Bug: #1508708
(cherry picked from commit e4a62a20b1d072969e842c38b2885a46a20fc54c)

commit_message:
Client : adding the tenant-id if specified for a net association creation

Currently the client doesn't add the tenant_id in its request.
If the tenant_id is specified in the CLI, it has to be integrated
in the request sent by the client.

This is at least needed when a tenant wants to create a network
association on behalf of a tenant.

Closes-bug: #1512711

Change-Id: I9e1038372d1ba36ad6e3d6ca8339d4fa03471a53

commit_message:
Sync Manila Tempest plugin with latest Tempest

Two reasons to do it:
1) Broken compatibility of old Tempest we use with latest dependencies.
2) Manila Tempest plugin is incompatible with latest Tempest.

Closes-Bug: #1513105

commit_message:
Avoiding usage of mutables as default arguments

Using Mutables objects as default arguments in function
definition is a known Python pitfall. This patch fixes
the issue in neutron-lbaas.

Change-Id: Idb1cccbebec5dfedde04ee474036e67569406caa
Closes-Bug: #1327473

subject: avoid generate temporary table when query samples
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-26 13:22:37.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/impl_sqlalchemy.py', 'ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': 'avoid generate temporary table when query samples

Currently, when we call query-samples API, for SQL backend, we do
an inner join to get a temporary table, then apply filters, orderby
and limit options on it. Such implementation will drain disk space
or cause timeout exception when data set is growing, even with specified
limit and filters.

This patch applies filters and limit on the inner join itself, and
uses a fake mapper object instead of temporary table to suit current
query transformer.

Change-Id: I261a2dd362ed51c16a6fa191dadcce1b45fce2e4
Closes-Bug: #1506738
(cherry picked from commit b9bf5f1f571f21aee4347c80a5a7ac8a1c456e45)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
avoid generate temporary table when query samples

Currently, when we call query-samples API, for SQL backend, we do
an inner join to get a temporary table, then apply filters, orderby
and limit options on it. Such implementation will drain disk space
or cause timeout exception when data set is growing, even with specified
limit and filters.

This patch applies filters and limit on the inner join itself, and
uses a fake mapper object instead of temporary table to suit current
query transformer.

Change-Id: I261a2dd362ed51c16a6fa191dadcce1b45fce2e4
Closes-Bug: #1506738
(cherry picked from commit b9bf5f1f571f21aee4347c80a5a7ac8a1c456e45)

commit_message:
Validate ethertype for icmp protocols

This patch will add the validation function to make sure security_group
rule is not created when ethertype is IPv4 and protocol is icmpv6.

Closes-Bug: #1505832
Depends-On: Ia1a5342a1d568cb1a015e1b7acecf38b8d1f46e1

Co-Authored By: Matt Dorn <madorn@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I4a15935c564aaa48555ed08f6da51113787ecb73

[{'created': '2015-11-03 22:21:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': 'Optimize delete_csnat_router_interface_ports db query

Currently delete_csnat_router_interface_ports provides an iterator as
filter to core_plugin.get_ports which is used in a SQL IN argument.
SQLAlchemy is able to avoid some db queries when the IN argument is
empty BUT not when the argument is an empty iterator and raises the
warning:

 SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "ports.id" was invoked with an empty
 sequence. This results in a contradiction, which nonetheless can be
 expensive to evaluate. Consider alternative strategies for improved
 performance.

This change replaces the iterator by a list in order to optimize db
queries when the filter is empty.

Closes-Bug: #1503852
Change-Id: I4f53433d688dfa020927118a18020b1a6aa55517
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Optimize delete_csnat_router_interface_ports db query

Currently delete_csnat_router_interface_ports provides an iterator as
filter to core_plugin.get_ports which is used in a SQL IN argument.
SQLAlchemy is able to avoid some db queries when the IN argument is
empty BUT not when the argument is an empty iterator and raises the
warning:

 SAWarning: The IN-predicate on "ports.id" was invoked with an empty
 sequence. This results in a contradiction, which nonetheless can be
 expensive to evaluate. Consider alternative strategies for improved
 performance.

This change replaces the iterator by a list in order to optimize db
queries when the filter is empty.

Closes-Bug: #1503852
Change-Id: I4f53433d688dfa020927118a18020b1a6aa55517

commit_message:
Fix iptables modules references in rule generation

The way we were generating rules with module references
for TCP, UDP, and ICMP was not matching the output of
iptables-save so all of the counters for those rules
were being destroyed on each iptables reload.

This patch corrects the generation so it's in line with
iptables-save output. It uses the matching module name only
when a specific port number or port range is specified.
It also uses the full 'ipv6-icmp' protocol name that shows
up in the output rather than 'icmpv6'.

Closes-Bug: #1502924
Change-Id: I1bf9a85cd299a7618d29c72991612898c5437442

commit_message:
Don't parse redhat-release for distro info

Python provides the platform module that can do this for us, and
it will simplify adding support for other distros in the future if
we aren't dependent on a redhat-specific file.

Also changes the exception raised from Exception to RuntimeError
because raising bare Exceptions is frowned upon.

Change-Id: I50d443918d802e94260a14be2f5a4e749e583703

[{'created': '2015-11-06 14:18:56.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/cloud_config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_cloud_config.py'], 'message': 'Work around a bug in keystoneclient constructor

keystoneclient bug #1513839 means that even when you proerly pass
a Session (like we do) to the discovery constructor (what you'd be
calling if you were passing "pass_version_arg = True") ksc fails
because you didn't send a URL.

We _HAVE_ an appropriate URL that we can pull from the Session. So
until ksc learns how to pull the URL from the Session itself, do it
for them.

Change-Id: I38eb4cfa750fab5196b86989c2cd498d41bf37ac
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Work around a bug in keystoneclient constructor

keystoneclient bug #1513839 means that even when you proerly pass
a Session (like we do) to the discovery constructor (what you'd be
calling if you were passing "pass_version_arg = True") ksc fails
because you didn't send a URL.

We _HAVE_ an appropriate URL that we can pull from the Session. So
until ksc learns how to pull the URL from the Session itself, do it
for them.

Change-Id: I38eb4cfa750fab5196b86989c2cd498d41bf37ac

commit_message:
Support pagination for ceilometer APIs

This spec aims to add support to the listing APIs call for limit,
marker, and sort_dir(sorted by timestamp) and groupby(especially
by event types) filters

Implements: blueprint ceilometer-events-pagination
Change-Id: I4bac0a5e4b8fc771fb10c66cf710a005d9808e71

commit_message:
Switch from nova_admin_* options for Neutron to actual

authentication plugins related options.

commit_message:
Nested Quota Driver: Create column allocated in Quota table

To represent the quotas allocated for the immediate child
projects we need to create a new column,"allocated" in Quota
table, that will be the sum of the "hard_limit" values of
the immediate child projects.

Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Erickson Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>

Change-Id: I6ec0aa2322b50a85d1eec2d3707650e7dc53f8c3
Partially Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-30 02:02:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade

In I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0, we broke backward
compatability when we switched from SIGUSR1 to SIGUSR2. This breaks
grenade jobs (Example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238479/).

So, let us allow a config option for operators to specify which
signal we should be handling for each service (depending on whether
it is running under mod_wsgi or not). By default we should just
handle both SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 to ensure both eventlet and
mod_wsgi scenarios are supported.

Closes-Bug: #1510740
Change-Id: I54ba70557f441fbd10eb085f79d594a9a33e1f11
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-02 12:57:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade

In I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0, we broke backward
compatability when we switched from SIGUSR1 to SIGUSR2. This breaks
grenade jobs (Example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238479/).

So for now, let's register both SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 and trigger a
warning in the log that SIGUSR1 has been deprecated. We should
remove use of SIGUSR1 in the O release. Hopefully this does not
break anything as when running under mod_wsgi SIGUSR1 is just
ignored (and SIGUSR2 will work) and both signals will work
under eventlet.

Closes-Bug: #1510740
Change-Id: I54ba70557f441fbd10eb085f79d594a9a33e1f11
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-11-06 11:40:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade

warning in the log that SIGUSR1 has been deprecated. We should

grenade jobs (Example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238479/).

So for now, let's register both SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 and trigger a

Change-Id: I54ba70557f441fbd10eb085f79d594a9a33e1f11

commit_message:
Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade

In I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0, we broke backward
compatability when we switched from SIGUSR1 to SIGUSR2. This breaks
grenade jobs (Example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238479/).

So for now, let's register both SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 and trigger a
warning in the log that SIGUSR1 has been deprecated. We should
remove use of SIGUSR1 in the O release. Hopefully this does not
break anything as when running under mod_wsgi SIGUSR1 is just
ignored (and SIGUSR2 will work) and both signals will work
under eventlet.

Closes-Bug: #1510740
Change-Id: I54ba70557f441fbd10eb085f79d594a9a33e1f11

commit_message:
[Reports] Switch task HTML report to Jinja2 templates

This is another step to complete usage of Jinja2 instead of Mako.
There are no features or refactoring within this patch, just switch
to another template engine.

Changes:
  * added template `base.html' as Jinja2 replacement of base.mako
    (which will be removed after the rest of templates are
    switched to base.html)
  * report.mako is replaced with report.html (Jinja2)

Change-Id: Ib4212a3e761597f5005dc1f19765713f1681cd16

commit_message:
Use separate queue for agent state reports.

This optimization is needed for big clusters with hundreds
of agents where the spike of activity may trigger a burst
of RPC requests that would prevent neutron-server from processing
agent heart beats in time, triggering resource rescheduling.

This will be further optimized by running dedicated RPC workers
for state reports processing.

Related-Bug: #1496410
Change-Id: Id86a1f962aaa4f64011d57ae55d240f890cca4f7
(cherry picked from commit 7267d75fdd3f90af759d71e9490cd41d41ba6d98)

[{'created': '2015-10-22 14:56:58.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/signature_utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_signature_utils.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Port signature_utils to Python 3

* Catch also binascii.Error when decoding Base64: Python 3 raises
  binascii.Error, not TypeError.
* Replace base64.b64decode() with base64.decode_as_bytes() to get
  accept also Unicode.
* verify_signature(): encode checksum_hash to UTF-8 if it's Unicode.
* Fix test_signature_utils: use byte strings
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.common.test_signature_utils

Change-Id: I386892f3e28f9454a438e414730318ec3f771342
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Port signature_utils to Python 3

* Catch also binascii.Error when decoding Base64: Python 3 raises
  binascii.Error, not TypeError.
* Replace base64.b64decode() with base64.decode_as_bytes() to get
  accept also Unicode.
* verify_signature(): encode checksum_hash to UTF-8 if it's Unicode.
* Fix test_signature_utils: use byte strings
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.common.test_signature_utils

Change-Id: I386892f3e28f9454a438e414730318ec3f771342

commit_message:
Validate arguments for command rally verify compare

Running 'rally verify compare' command, if uuid is empty, it will
gives a unfriendly message.
This patch validate uuid agrument, and raise a friendly message
when meets an exception.

Closes-Bug: #1512707
Change-Id: Ibb6cb0b16a1d4871ac1ff229e5dd67606e3541e0

commit_message:
Allow Orchestration of Image Backend

Adds a horizon::image_backend parameter that can be overriden to allow
explicit definition of the supported image types etc. that are supported for
the end user.  The underlying python representation per setting is an array of
tuples, however in puppet and hiera this is a hash as all options have an
order of 2.  A typical configuration may look like:

  horizon::image_backend:
    image_formats:
      '':    'Select image format'
      qcow2: 'QCOW2 - QEMU Emulator'
      raw:   'Raw'

Change-Id: Ieb92240ed86f67b73911ec627312093e797fa15f
