commit_message:
[Tech debt] Multiple floating ranges support

* Add 'objects.Release.is_multiple_floating_ranges_enabled' method.
* According to open/closed principle, move logic of 'generate_external_network'
  method to 'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer80' and revert changes made in
  'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer51'.
* Refactor and remove testing redundancy in 'TestNeutronDeploymentSerializer70'
  and 'TestNeutronDeploymentSerializer80'.

Change-Id: I993c22bf2ca65f8e3c01301c92e3f0987b403244
Partial-bug: #1490578

commit_message:
[ovs] agent: postpone AMQP consumer declaration to as late as possible

This should allow us to avoid on the wire AMQP messages before we are
sure setup is correct, and also should allow us to fail gracefully on
bridge configuration issues without creating AMQP fanout queues that are
never cleaned up neither by the agent nor by AMQP brokers.

The idea of the patch is to declare topics only when we are ready to
connect consumers to those topics.

Note that RPC client calls would not trigger consumer declaration
because those are defined on connection objects that are not involved in
RPC call mechanism.

Change-Id: I982be11cab5351472b699d643c970ee7f18c5b35
Closes-Bug: #1505244

commit_message:
Fix incorrect passing port dict in pluggable IPAM

_ipam_allocate_ips expects to receive port dict as a third argument, but
'changes' were passed instead.

This issue affects only third-party vendors who implement own IPAM
driver with custom AddressRequestFactory and uses port dict in it.

Updated arguments passed to _ipam_allocate_ips to include port dict as a
third argument.

Change-Id: I25eb86f46e5412cfacad9a751a94f7720f1a7bd0
Closes-Bug: #1511707
(cherry picked from commit 600a0db48a766437a91b427da8eeb3f066963db2)

commit_message:
Few improvements in Kolla tools. Added Ubuntu support.

pip install default prefix in Ubuntu is /usr/local, and Kolla tools scripts
didnt respect that. So I added few OS checks in this scripts.

I improve config path check in build.py. Added more verbose error if we can't
find config directory.

Change-Id: Ide521ed205b0dc1fc27e237a9a8f4da0168e664f
Closes-Bug: #1512302

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-26 19:37:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Execute mount.nfs check as root

Currently the existence of 'mount.nfs' is checked with a non-root user,
in this case cinder. This results, for example on SUSE, in the error:

      NfsException: mount.nfs is not installed

Because mount.nfs is located under /sbin, unprivileged users do not have
/sbin in their PATH to search for executables.
This change switches the parameter run_as_root to true, to find the binary
in privileged directories, as well.

Change-Id: I3c1ecfdadd9ea492d58d69cbdf33045b002668c7
Closes-Bug: #1510150
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-26 19:40:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Execute mount.nfs check as root

in this case cinder. This results, for example on SUSE, in the error:

      NfsException: mount.nfs is not installed

Because mount.nfs is located under /sbin, unprivileged users do not have

Closes-Bug: #1510150
", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2015-11-04 12:39:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Execute mount.nfs check with absolute path /sbin/mount.nfs

Currently the existence of 'mount.nfs' is checked by running the relative binary
mount.nfs with a non-root user,in this case cinder.
This results, for example on SUSE, in the error:

      NfsException: mount.nfs is not installed

Because mount.nfs is located under /sbin, unprivileged users do not have
/sbin in their PATH to search for executables.
The change runs the mount.nfs check by using the absolute binary path /sbin/mount.nfs.
This seems to be common for most distributions (SUSE, RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu, Debian).
The check can still be executed as non privileged user, by not relying on correct PATH
variable and using the absolute path.

Change-Id: I3c1ecfdadd9ea492d58d69cbdf33045b002668c7
Closes-Bug: #1510150

      NfsException: mount.nfs is not installed

Because mount.nfs is located under /sbin, unprivileged users
do not have /sbin in their PATH to search for executables.
The change runs the mount.nfs check by using the absolute binary
path /sbin/mount.nfs. This seems to be common for most distributions

commit_message:
Execute mount.nfs check with absolute path

Currently the existence of mount.nfs is checked by executing
the relative binary 'mount.nfs' with a non-root user,
in this case cinder. This results, for example on SUSE, in the error:

      NfsException: mount.nfs is not installed

Because mount.nfs is located under /sbin, unprivileged users
do not have /sbin in their PATH to search for executables.
The change runs the mount.nfs check by using the absolute binary
path /sbin/mount.nfs. This seems to be common for most distributions
(SUSE, RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu, Debian). The check can still be executed
as non privileged user, by not relying on correctly set PATH variable
and using the absolute path.

Change-Id: I3c1ecfdadd9ea492d58d69cbdf33045b002668c7
Closes-Bug: #1510150

commit_message:
[packetary] Infrastructure improvments.

* Added retry for 404 (HTTP Status).
* Added method for downloading the file to the ConnectionManager.
* AsynchronousSection collects all exceptions with traceback and
     log it after all tasks has been completed.
* generator.gen_relation returns object instead of list
* GzipDecompress: fixed case when there is not enough data to decompress next chunk

Change-Id: Ie2014aeee0c4776ed411ef6f28a996ef2d029c95

commit_message:
Keystone Spelling Errors in docstrings and comments

Good Morning Keystone Tokyo. I wanted to give you guys an easy
review to do when you wake up.

I have noticed a few spelling errors in docstrings and comments
throughout keystone.  In this patch I fix all of the spelling
errors I could find.

Change-Id: I7233a6a7e1fc5c14c85049f362f03ea111704842

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-24 14:49:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environements when the images are in use.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-02-24 14:51:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environements when the images are in use.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

Closes-Bug: #1425100

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-02-26 12:56:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environements when the images are in use.

The Linux SMBFS driver uses 'du', which gives incorrect values in
case of VHD/X images.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

As the Windows SMBFS driver inherits the Linux SMBFS driver, only
overwriting the os specific methods, the fix is applied to the base
SMBFS driver.

Closes-Bug: #1425100

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60

commit_message:
SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environments when the images are in use.

The Linux SMBFS driver uses 'du', which gives incorrect values in
case of VHD/X images.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

As the Windows SMBFS driver inherits the Linux SMBFS driver, only
overwriting the os specific methods, the fix is applied to the base
SMBFS driver.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1425100

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60

commit_message:
[Reports] Add support of Jinja2 templates in ui.utils.get_template()

This patch starts switching UI templates to Jinja2 and makes
function rally.ui.utils.get_template() returning
jinja2.environment.Template, as well as already implemented
mako.template.Template.

Mako is used only if template file name ends with ".mako",
with deprecation warning.

Jinja templates will replace Mako templates in further patches.

Change-Id: Id12f1392414548c2465fd8c0a7a7ed20f4eeed6a

commit_message:
bootstrap takes place on the wrong node

The bootstrap must occur on the nova-api node due to binding in the
nova-api directory (same goes for all other services)

Closes-Bug: #1513439
Backport: Liberty
Change-Id: Iab88b49712828085e4d7e7f85e6d8f0b7999a9bf
(cherry picked from commit e2bc9dcf79d0780b765545b796db114ad2f52eca)

commit_message:
Restrucutre gate scripts

So we can respect DRY and share as much code as possible I have broken
out the common code between the aio and multinode gate scripts.

Additionally, this lays the ground work for removing our policy on
root-everywhere by using sudo. Once we get the non-root stuff worked
out we can gate as non-root user.

Change-Id: I781c597ab10f2296b95f51ae27e0fa617ffe0a66
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
(cherry picked from commit 3d7a0c6f55d5d4db33ff5ecb25466423e5d36b2d)

commit_message:
Remove unused setup_fedora.sh

The Fedora code is no longer used and can be removed. Should it be needed in the
future the code is very similiar to CentOS. As is it will just become out of
date as the code is never excersied.

Change-Id: I7df832e5b0830ac8b4507f000ed8ed6e43d39463
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
(cherry picked from commit e4b84fbeacb892a47121541177af83b0117f91d7)

commit_message:
Enable try_except_pass Bandit test

The try_except_pass test checks that pass isn't used in an except
block because it's the source of lots of security issues. The
current instances of pass in an except block are marked as nosec.

Change-Id: I73af6b80fa75286e96943026b7b71ad23dc1786b

commit_message:
Remove "result" and "published" fields for task API

Currently the "/v2/tasks" API returns the "result" and "published" fields.
These fields can contain large amounts of data and this could have a big
impact on network and performance.

Change-Id: I0b4180d5ea119843542a121344dfb9653c54ab89
Closes-Bug: #1476610

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-20 08:39:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint return value form

In current implementation, allocated port configuration is passed as
return value in interface description in both the cases:
1. remote network driver was supplied a non-empty value in Interface
2. remote network driver was supplied empty value in Interface
But for non-empty interface case, libnetwork expects empty interface
description as success response.

"If the remote process was supplied a non-empty value in Interface, it
must respond with an empty Interface value. LibNetwork will treat it
as an error if it supplies a non-empty value and receives a non-empty
value back, and roll back the operation."

https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/docs/remote.md#create-endpoint

commit_message:
Fix /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint return value form

In current implementation, allocated port configuration is passed as
return value in interface description in both the cases:
1. remote network driver was supplied a non-empty value in Interface
2. remote network driver was supplied empty value in Interface
But for non-empty interface case, libnetwork expects empty values
of interface description fields which are passed non-empty value.
For example if input interface is:
        Interface': {
                u'AddressIPv6': u''
                u'MacAddress': u'',
                u'Address': u'172.18.0.2/16'
        },
In the response interface description, 'Address' MUST be empty. For
empty fields in request, accepted reponse values are both empty or
non-empty. If kuryr driver has allocated IP it should be sent back in
response, so that in 'docker inspect' output user can see kuryr
allocated IP.
But for non-empty field in request, only empty response
is considered success.

"If the remote process was supplied a non-empty value in Interface, it
must respond with an empty Interface value. LibNetwork will treat it
as an error if it supplies a non-empty value and receives a non-empty
value back, and roll back the operation."

Reference:
https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/docs/remote.md#create-endpoint
https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/drivers/remote/driver.go#L136

Change-Id: I0acce8c14457919f9a9ada5e728a71ca36db14e1
Closes-Bug: #1507895

commit_message:
Making instance_name_template configurable.

This will allow users to configure the value.
The parameter will be added only if required,
and exposed via heat templates.

instance_name_template is a template string
to be used to generate instance names.

Added spec tests for instance_name_template

Change-Id: Ic2b9b9f34521afbb2744690945230e14052f84d2

commit_message:
Fix reference to puppetlabs/stdlib in Puppetfile

This commit fixes an erroneous reference to '4.x' branch, which does not
(or no longer) exists. Instead, it points it at 4.9.0, which is the
latest version advertised on the forge.

Change-Id: I2d04d7d10cbd2becde00fb2e21913b92f7b9dc03

commit_message:
Fix base ci test

using cephx without mon_initial_members appears to cause a bug where
ceph-create-keys runs, creates the keys, but doesn't add them to ceph auth.
Adding mon_initial_members resolves this issue.

Change-Id: I14e49c0c89449ef9a8bfdc630a172405c940fe6f

commit_message:
Read the response body, if response status is greater than 300.

internal_client was not reading response if response status is not 200.
So proxy server treats this as client disconnect and logs 499 in log file.
This patch fixes that by reading response if response status is greater
than or equal to 300 and in acceptable statuses.

Closes-Bug: #1364752

Change-Id: I0512a25895da583956f76031e3c5de5c970bce01

subject: Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 2455, 'name': 'Tihomir Trifonov', 'email': 't.trifonov@gmail.com', 'username': 'ttrifonov'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 5623, 'name': 'David Lyle', 'email': 'dklyle0@gmail.com', 'username': 'david-lyle'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 14188, 'name': 'Alexander Bozhenko', 'email': 'abozhenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'abozhenko'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-07-29 13:55:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table

Neutron API supports filtering in listing API. If long filter parameters
such as long UUID list are passed, it exceeds URL length limit and
RequestURITooLong is raised. In such case, we need to split filter
parameters into chunks.

This commit add a convenient method to handle the case, which split
a list of long filter parameter into chunks and repeat listing API call.
However, it is not easy to generalize this behavior because filtering
parameters are specific to caller's logic, so this patch only fixes
a problem in servers_update_addresses().

Change-Id: I63ec4bad722351f640797bcbec4a38d5972f135c
Closes-Bug: #1349841
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-28 00:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/neutron_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/network_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py'], 'message': "Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table

Neutron API supports filtering in listing API. If long filter parameters
such as long UUID list are passed, it exceeds URL length limit and
RequestURITooLong is raised. In such case, we need to split filter
parameters into chunks.

This commit add a convenient method to handle the case, which split
a list of long filter parameter into chunks and repeat listing API call.
However, it is not easy to generalize this behavior because filtering
parameters are specific to caller's logic, so this patch only fixes
a problem in servers_update_addresses().

Change-Id: I63ec4bad722351f640797bcbec4a38d5972f135c
Closes-Bug: #1349841
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table

Neutron API supports filtering in listing API. If long filter parameters
such as long UUID list are passed, it exceeds URL length limit and
RequestURITooLong is raised. In such case, we need to split filter
parameters into chunks.

This commit add a convenient method to handle the case, which split
a list of long filter parameter into chunks and repeat listing API call.
However, it is not easy to generalize this behavior because filtering
parameters are specific to caller's logic, so this patch only fixes
a problem in servers_update_addresses().

Change-Id: I63ec4bad722351f640797bcbec4a38d5972f135c
Closes-Bug: #1349841

helpfull for end-user to see where is the folder/file.

commit_message:
Remove mysql-devel cruft

This was conflicting with Percona-Server-devel-55 and broke centos
source build for openstack-base image.

Backport: Liberty
Change-Id: Ia2bb2106038e8e2eadb6668f4ae1ad1d95710c09
Closes-Bug: #1513711

commit_message:
Resolve the request API problem to Post V3/policy

Using the Sample Rest API of policy V3 version, we cannot create
Policy with the method of POST.

Insert the 'policy' dict and update the request like here, it worked!

Change-Id: Idec2b1e74f32e2fcc4e22f0b63083848e428b7fb

subject: Resolved encoding/decoding problem.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 05:21:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Resolved encoding/decoding problem.

In MIMEtext by default encodes in 'us-ascii'
for py27 and 'utf-8' in py34. So 'utf-8'
encoding is specified in argument.

Also in py27 constant string is already in unicode
type but in py34 it is byte type. So
string is decoded for py27 in unit test.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I7004bae1d46d20630a30cac1abb65efe68765401
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-05 08:54:59.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/actions/test_std_email_action.py', 'mistral/actions/std_actions.py'], 'message': "Resolved encoding/decoding problem.

In MIMEtext by default encodes in 'us-ascii'
for py27 and 'utf-8' in py34. So 'utf-8'
encoding is specified in argument.

Also in py27 constant string is already in unicode
type but in py34 it is byte type. So
string is decoded for py27 in unit test.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I7004bae1d46d20630a30cac1abb65efe68765401
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Resolved encoding/decoding problem.

In MIMEtext by default encodes in 'us-ascii'
for py27 and 'utf-8' in py34. So 'utf-8'
encoding is specified in argument.

Also in py27 constant string is already in unicode
type but in py34 it is byte type. So
string is decoded for py27 in unit test.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I7004bae1d46d20630a30cac1abb65efe68765401

subject: WIP: Add tempest run command to unified cli
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-01 00:03:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: Add tempest run command to unified cli

This commit adds a 'tempest run' command to the unified tempest cli,
the next step in the new workflow for running tempest. After a local
working tempest directory is setup using the tempest init command you
then will use tempest run to run tempest from that working dir.

At this point the run command is very basic, and just exposes some
basic options. This interface will be grown over time to add more
features and include support for loading external tempest plugins.
But for right now this commit starts small and just adds a basic
interface for running and selecting tests, similar to what is
provided via our current use of tox.

Partially implements bp tempest-cli-improvements

Change-Id: Ib4a906db78bc7852f13874d72533300d26a0fb16

commit_message:
WIP: Add tempest run command to unified cli

This commit adds a 'tempest run' command to the unified tempest cli,
the next step in the new workflow for running tempest. After a local
working tempest directory is setup using the tempest init command you
then will use tempest run to run tempest from that working dir.

At this point the run command is very basic, and just exposes some
basic options. This interface will be grown over time to add more
features and include support for loading external tempest plugins.
But for right now this commit starts small and just adds a basic
interface for running and selecting tests, similar to what is
provided via our current use of tox.

Partially implements bp tempest-cli-improvements

Change-Id: Ib4a906db78bc7852f13874d72533300d26a0fb16

commit_message:
Fix example and test values for journal disks

* if providing an external journal disk, provide the disk and not
  the partition
* do not put things into /tmp

commit_message:
Add unit tests for utils.validate_hash_path

This patch add some unit tests to prevent regression and to describe
validate_hash_path behavior, I found in review with

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/231864/

*bonus*
- Fix test_hash_path to use "with" syntax instead of "try/finally"
  for assigning a testing value into a global variable.

Change-Id: I948999a8fb8addb9a378dbf8bee853b205aeafad

commit_message:
bootstrap takes place on the wrong node

The bootstrap must occur on the nova-api node due to binding in the
nova-api directory (same goes for all other services)

Closes-Bug: #1513439
Backport: Liberty
Change-Id: Iab88b49712828085e4d7e7f85e6d8f0b7999a9bf

commit_message:
Allow disabling of sysctl values

The main reason for this change is to allow the DinD stuff to work. It
has limited use outside of that use case, but it may still be useful
to others in the future.

Change-Id: Ib3a4639cfb3fc0d378d33fc8b9ff8eb597f818ab
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate

commit_message:
Expose versioning information on GET / endpoint

This returns 'min_version' (minimum supported version), 'version'
(current/maximum supported version), and 'status' (of the version,
is 'CURRENT' for v1) in the response to a GET / request.
It makes our response to / very close to Nova's one[0], and will allow
us to implement a `ironic version-list` command similar to Nova's.

As this change is needed for proper versioning support on client
side, it's not versioned itself. Otherwise we'll have a
chicken-and-egg problem.

[0]http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.html#versioning

Closes-Bug: #1489172
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@yahoo-inc.com>
Change-Id: I6dd1ea20e23137d9a9566355adc0784067d2cb5b

commit_message:
Add PortOpt to config generator

The oslo.config library provides new type PortOpt, and there's a
patch[1] wants to introduce that to Ironic.

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238376/

commit_message:
Fix to disable meter-links on resource-list CLI

This adds an optional param to resource-list
CLI to disable meter-links. By default its
False to maintain backward compatibility.

A different patch for the same issue has been
done on master since master has meter-links
disabled by default, whereas on kilo, its enabled
by default.

see: I308b94c8a57833cf30b4815ecec2ff9a50e91af6

Closes-Bug: #1508708

Change-Id: I6f3fa6f485a604d8b027486795a0865327acfcd6

users to add command line parameters to the db sync command.

commit_message:
DVR: only notify needed agents on new VM port creation

When a new VM which should be serviced by a DVR router appears
on compute host, this router is scheduled to that host and
notification is sent. Before the patch it was a broad notification
while really we only need to notify agent on target host.
This should decrease the load on neutron server at scale.

Closes-Bug: #1486795
Change-Id: Id48b6f6a71530c4f6092d2a07b2db1a5cd300c05

commit_message:
Support for services different only by type.

First, Keystone_service provider was not able to create service
different by type.  So service type computev3 and compute with name nova
could not be created.

Second, on a system with such resource it would not be able to
differentiate between the two.  Then if

   keystone_service {'nova': type => 'compute'}

was in the catalog, then the service nova/computev3 would be changed to
nova/compute.

Now you can specify:

   keystone_service {'service::type'}

or

   keystone_service {'service': type => 'type'}

It keeps a full backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I24bbcf8cbf3760fd061e2439f37864ae97ce86f6
Closes-Bug: #1508886

commit_message:
Remove vip for rabbitmq

Adjust all the configs to list all the rabbitmq hosts rather than
running rabbitmq through the VIP. This is made possible by clusterer
which has already merged.

Change-Id: I5db48f5f10ec68f4c8863a29bc13984f6845a4f9
Partially-Implements: blueprint rabbitmq-clusterer

DNM: Add bdm_field_is_new() to BlockDeviceMapping

changed.

commit_message:
Add new context manager for shade exceptions, cont.

This commit continues the work of
 change Ic39b6e3efc33b7a30f298a3daca6d6c16ab4ca89

Shade has developed a common pattern within many of the API
methods where we try to avoid re-wrapping OpenStackClientException
exceptions by catching them and simply re-raising. We can eliminate
this duplicate exception handling with a context manager.

Change-Id: Ifd97181b33ed72bb9ad5b3da1e2b92a660e12a65

commit_message:
Bump ironicclient depend

ironicclient 0.10.0 drops the lxml requirement. Let's set the min in
shade to that so that we make sure people don't try to install lxml.

Change-Id: I942de581e15017de9706cabd2eb759eec578565e
Depends-On: I6f0e5d7f3d97a5fb6a948d653633b067dfe258f7

commit_message:
cleanup of emc-vnx-driver xml file

added the where necessary
changed computer node to compute node
changed vm to VM
changed tht to that - typo
corrected run on sentences
added hyphen when necessary to comply w/rest of doc

commit_message:
Add caching to get_catalog

This commit adds caching to the get_catalog call, per user ID and
project ID. Both the v2 and v3 catalogs are built based on the result of
this method, so this provides caching for both APIs.

As a result, this should provide a performance benefit to Fernet-based
deployments, which must otherwise rebuild the catalog on each token
validation.

Tested on top of the current stable/liberty, this patch improves the
time of cacheable Fernet token creation requests by 16.7% and of
Fernet token validation requests by 7.5%:

  https://gist.github.com/dolph/3bf24039b83a147eeb5c

Change-Id: I147c5b8e7dcfe1786fe8a534182dbeef33925eac
Co-Authored-By: Dolph Mathews <dolph.mathews@gmail.com>
Related-Bug: 1489061

commit_message:
Use rsrc_defn_from_snippet for ResourceGroup

This uses resource_defn_from_snippet in build_resource_defintion.
This also changes build_resource_defintion for dependent
Software/Strcutured DeploymentGroup. Also uses scaling library
make_template to build the template in _assemble_nested.

Change-Id: I548b75ea30cf79706e247beba4c4eb4449101742

commit_message:
Optimize the code performance

Usually, the number of characters in FORBIDDEN_CHARS are fewer than
the number of characters in the req.path - so it's better to use
smaller count for the outer loop.

Change-Id: I78b7e0ff4cae1cc90e8d29d7bddcec7fe0ba4bd4

commit_message:
Always process node addresses

Never return a node without an address, otherwise the call to CLB
will fail.

Change-Id: I443b568f509246f8d38a8ddcf0ce4b1d1fd0c689

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: create unique constraint on block_device_mapping table

This is to see if we can figure out where cells is creating duplicate
bdm entries for a volume-backed snapshot.

Related-Bug: #1489581

Change-Id: Ia3347bbf5a6b49c2778b1eff76a9a3f4fecbd22f

The latest os-client-config release, 1.10.0, makes sure that all

commit_message:
Make sure cache expiration time is an int

The latest os-client-config release, 1.10.0, makes sure that all
numerical values are strings. But we need to pass an int to the
cache configure stuff.

Change-Id: I5d5e42440afd58111daeab6a5f42aa9ae7ceddf4

commit_message:
Update CLI reference for python-novaclient 2.34.0

The number of commands is not changed.(same as 2.33.0)
But ten commands order is changed.
    (The command list is same as 2.33.0)
  host-evacuate
  migration-list
  list-extensions
  host-meta
  instance-action
  instance-action-list
  host-evacuate-live
  cell-capacities
  cell-show
  host-servers-migrate

Change-Id: Ia3a3ab4f2c3915cccf841931a9f32e463bcc02ff

commit_message:
Restrict requests to fedora

The os_RELEASE for RHEL is 7.1 (for example). Which does not work for comparisons
to an integer.  And, while I am at it, change base_path to not use a hard-coded
directory.

Change-Id: I64a04810cc7ba4668c2cb7a8df79c206301e9e16

commit_message:
Correct Cinder protocol for connections on Ironic

The protocol for connections with Cinder is wrong for the Ironic script. This
patch changes the script to use $GLANCE_SERVICE_PROTOCOL, which is https when
USE_SSL=true or tls-proxy is on ENABLED_SERVICES.

Change-Id: I4d4c6f9dc6f6ee53166db109848dca64334b8748

commit_message:
keystone: fix prefixed URL

Commit 2ad1a42ca667ff21e6f7d2ae906be23a20430036 broke entirely the
Apache configuration for Keystone when used without a port on the
/identity URL. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I47805138c66456c9c5fa9af1f4ac33b03d0ce5b9

commit_message:
Made instance state values in the CSV summary translatable

The instance state values ("Active", "Stopped" and others)
captured in the CSV Summary from the Project Overview page
were not translatable.  Two changes were needed.  Some of the
possible values from Nova were missing from the STATUS_DISPLAY_CHOICES
tuple and needed to be added.  Then the state values
needed to be translated into the proper locale when the CSV was
built.  It should be noted that I used the same style Lucas Palm
proposed in change 226579 (launchpad 1490031) for the second change.

Change-Id: Ib52d4c1fade22199390c6a568fc8f1101784a88d
Closes-Bug: #1496953

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-28 14:18:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Switch NOVA_VERSION from deprecated 1.1 to 2.0

Nova API v1.1 was deprecated a long time ago. Also novaclient maps 1.1 on 2
so let's move to use 2.0 directly

Change-Id: I47856863e9403870b8d60c778b97d3de1a212ae1
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-30 14:36:46.000000000', 'files': ['exercises/client-args.sh', 'exercises/client-env.sh', 'openrc'], 'message': "Remove wrong paramter COMPUTE_API_VERSION

Since:
 - novaclient doesn't require specify the *compute api* version
  (default is 2.latest now)
 - novaclient doesn't use COMPUTE_API_VERSION, since it's wrong name(
   OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION is a correct name)

we can remove COMPUTE_API_VERSION and NOVA_VERSION vars

Change-Id: I47856863e9403870b8d60c778b97d3de1a212ae1
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove wrong paramter COMPUTE_API_VERSION

Since:
 - novaclient doesn't require specify the *compute api* version
  (default is 2.latest now)
 - novaclient doesn't use COMPUTE_API_VERSION, since it's wrong name(
   OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION is a correct name)

we can remove COMPUTE_API_VERSION and NOVA_VERSION vars

Change-Id: I47856863e9403870b8d60c778b97d3de1a212ae1

commit_message:
Switch from deprecated nova_admin_ options to actual ones

nova_admin_* options are deprecated since Kilo and should be replaced with
an authentication plugin related options

Closes-bug: #1503753

subject: Turn off tracing for service functions
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-14 03:57:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Turn of tracing for service functions

These functions commonly externally called (as part of stackrc
inclusion, even) and do a fair bit of iteration over long
service-lists, which really fills up the logs of devstack and grenade
with unnecessary details.

The functions are well tested by unit-tests, so we are very unlikely
to need to debug internal issues with them in a hurry.  Thus turn
logging down for them.

Change-Id: I63b9a05a0678c7e0c7012f6d768c29fd67f090d2
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-14 05:36:33.000000000', 'files': ['functions-common'], 'message': 'Turn off tracing for service functions

These functions commonly externally called (as part of stackrc
inclusion, even) and do a fair bit of iteration over long
service-lists, which really fills up the logs of devstack and grenade
with unnecessary details.

The functions are well tested by unit-tests, so we are very unlikely
to need to debug internal issues with them in a hurry.  Thus turn
logging down for them.

Change-Id: I63b9a05a0678c7e0c7012f6d768c29fd67f090d2
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Turn off tracing for service functions

These functions commonly externally called (as part of stackrc
inclusion, even) and do a fair bit of iteration over long
service-lists, which really fills up the logs of devstack and grenade
with unnecessary details.

The functions are well tested by unit-tests, so we are very unlikely
to need to debug internal issues with them in a hurry.  Thus turn
logging down for them.

Change-Id: I63b9a05a0678c7e0c7012f6d768c29fd67f090d2

commit_message:
Stop keystone admin from listening on public interface

As discussed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/175958/, we
probably don't want the keystone admin api listening on the public
interface.

Change-Id: I8c717ff3abbe3dc1d7febae800c6d3e64749619b

commit_message:
Fix OpenStack Health header link

In order to OpenStack Health header link work properly it must have the
number sign (#) on it. The link wasn't working previously.

Also, this specific link had a duplicate id. So we're using this same
commit to fix that.

Change-Id: I041c876e315e8de2f969372a5ad0c8ec87199f45

In Juno, a few Keystone LDAP variables had names differing from the
associated configuration options.
Through the juno-kilo-ldap-conversion.py script, ensure that these

Change-Id: I49b5352173b01cad65d7581a22923adedb0beec2
Closes-Bug: #1506597
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename Keystone LDAP entries during Kilo upgrade

In Juno, a few Keystone LDAP variables had names differing from the
associated configuration options.
Through the juno-kilo-ldap-conversion.py script, ensure that these
variables are renamed when upgrading to Kilo.

Change-Id: I49b5352173b01cad65d7581a22923adedb0beec2
Closes-Bug: #1506597

commit_message:
Revert "Support OFFLINE mode"

This reverts commit 42287ef16ddfb70ff8ccfec6c94677e52863c8d7.

Conflicts:
	devstack/plugin.sh

This breaks the tempest gate job as it runs with ERROR_ON_CLONE=True.
There also seems to be other problems when run locally.

Change-Id: I981fd2e80067ac459c1b2b427ef16babdb64d4d6
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add CDH test enabling HDFS HA

We add three HDFS_JOURNALNODE roles in the cluster template to
enable HDFS NameNode HA. We did not directly modified in
cdh-5.4.0.yaml.mako file, or it makes CI test too long and may
exceed the timeout.

Partial-implements: blueprint cdh-ha-support
Change-Id: I173027c0511ee5e7f76ea485b13089a3a5839ece

commit_message:
hacking check for contextlib.nested for py34 support

Removed use of contextlib.nested call from codebase as
contextlib.nested is not compatible with Python 3.

Added hacking check to catch if any new instances are added
to the codebase.

Change-Id: Ib78102bc013e4cc91ba54d79aa2815f4cf9f446d

revisions:

The current IPv4 address sorting will only work on tables such as

commit_message:
Make IPv4 address sorting work on all tables

The current IPv4 address sorting will only work on tables such as
Instances where the IP address cell content is a list. This patch
makes the sorting also work on other tables such as Floating IPs
where the cell content is not a list.

Closes-Bug: #1504136
Change-Id: I098cde44d03188925fa452ae83fe65a91897758b

commit_message:
Fix DVR interface delete by port when gateway is set

When removing a DVR interface by port, the subnet_id
passed to delete_csnat_router_interface_ports is None,
and so it deletes all the DVR SNAT ports for the
router.

This patch fixes this issue by passing in the right
subnet_id to the delete_csnat_router_interface_ports.

Conflicts:
	neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py
	neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py

Change-Id: I16735195c6575454876acd0e99ef45f382963566
Closes-Bug: #1443524
Co-Authored-By: Swaminathan Vasudevan <swaminathan.vasudevan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0b5b6c7e746839d3f9bece6e782092bca3c9725e)

commit_message:
DHCP: protect against case when device name is None

There are edge cases when the agent attempts to unplug an interface and
the device does not exist.

Closes-bug: #1498370
(cherry picked from commit caebc8fb8e8d9782746c3cc3ddc86f786342c819)
(cherry picked from commit 0b07910f33ed26fbdd13530eafbdefd74104424d)

After introducing the commit 93d26e40098c966e7d791a9fb6152244a9f9409d
unit test TestCinderAllCmd fails if a test environment has
/etc/cinder/cinder.conf with proper backend configuration.
We should mock out some variables not to depend on test environment.

Closes-Bug: #1513263
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix failure of unit test TestCinderAllCmd

After introducing the commit 93d26e40098c966e7d791a9fb6152244a9f9409d
unit test TestCinderAllCmd fails if a test environment has
/etc/cinder/cinder.conf with proper backend configuration.
We should mock out some variables not to depend on test environment.

Change-Id: I3218f6be1c38ed228aa96346d6976a04ecb8d421
Closes-Bug: #1513263

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-15 10:21:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use versionadded and versionchanged in doc

Document in which version new types and functions were added using
".. versionadded:: x.y". Document changes using
".. versionchanged:: x.y."

When a whole module was added in a version, use the versionadded tag
in the module top docstring, not on each type/function.

I used "git blame" + "git tag --contains=SHA1" to find these version,
and then I checked manually each version.

Change-Id: Ieb8b3cbb1cb71a98cb714c410635b5c45f1afb08

commit_message:
Use versionadded and versionchanged in doc

Document in which version new types and functions were added using
".. versionadded:: x.y". Document changes using
".. versionchanged:: x.y."

When a whole module was added in a version, use the versionadded tag
in the module top docstring, not on each type/function.

I used "git blame" + "git tag --contains=SHA1" to find these version,
and then I checked manually each version.

Change-Id: Ieb8b3cbb1cb71a98cb714c410635b5c45f1afb08

commit_message:
Use versionadded and versionchanged in doc

Document in which version new types and functions were added using
".. versionadded:: x.y". Document changes using
".. versionchanged:: x.y."

For new modules, add the versionadded tag in the module top
docstring, not on each type/function.

Add fileutils to documentation. The doc part was forgotten during the
graduation.

Add docstrings to convert versions of versionutils.

I used "git blame" + "git tag --contains=SHA1" to find these version,
and then I checked manually each version.

Change-Id: Ia2f00aa29eb36410a49fc1d350896a569a7737a1

commit_message:
Allow specifying a kazoo async handler 'kind'

In situations where the built-in (and default) kazoo
threading async handler does not work (which sometimes
appears to happen under eventlet) allow for specifying
a different handler (ie the 'eventlet' one) that should
work better under those scenarios.

Closes-bug: #1512001

Change-Id: Iec5e39928b223a3ffca0b9b5b4d0fd61abaa0f2b

commit_message:
Fixes and improvements after testing on RabbitMQ cluster:

1) adds tcp_user_timeout parameter - timiout for unacked tcp pockets
2) adds host_connection_reconnect_delay parameter - delay for
reconnection to some host if error occurs during connection. 
It allows to use other hosts if we have some host disconnected
3) adds rpc_listener_ack and rpc_listener_prefetch_count properties -
enable consumer acknowledges and set maximum number of unacknowledged
messages
4) fixes time units (in oslo.messaging it is seconds but in RabbitMQ -
milliseconds)

Change-Id: Ifd549a1eebeef27a3d36ceb6d3e8b1c76ea00b65

subject: Improve default type checking
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-23 11:29:18.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_config/tests/test_cfg.py', 'oslo_config/cfg.py', 'oslo_config/types.py'], 'message': 'Improve default type checking

Previous type checking used the BASE_TYPE value to test the default,
however the type can be used directly to test the default instead. This
cleans up the default type checking and also improves the checking. The
default can now use all information passed into the Type object for
testing the default.

Change-Id: I7e8c2c71ba7db2a9a48aa29c12376b74a1f072f6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve default type checking

Previous type checking used the BASE_TYPE value to test the default,
however the type can be used directly to test the default instead. This
cleans up the default type checking and also improves the checking. The
default can now use all information passed into the Type object for
testing the default.

Change-Id: I7e8c2c71ba7db2a9a48aa29c12376b74a1f072f6

subject: Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-22 17:12:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Change-Id: I5177b5360811499fbffb120a0f63e94d999710f3

commit_message:
Try to use zuul-cloner to prepare fixtures

In OpenStack Infra, we would like to run Puppet unit tests that
sometimes depends on other Puppet OpenStack modules.
Example: a patch in puppet-openstacklib that needs to be tested in puppet-nova.

This patch modifies the Rakefile to:
* clean spec_prep and spec_clean Rake tasks
* use openstack/puppet-openstack-integration/install_modules_unit.sh script
  to clone modules.
* do not use .fixtures.yaml file to clone modules and rely on
  zuul-cloner or git.
* Add openstack/ in gitignore so we never commit the
  puppet-openstack-integration repository (can happen when spec_clean
  did not run but you want to submit the patch anyway)
* Allow to run a custom Puppetfile if PUPPETFILE env is exported. It
  will allow people to test the module with the dependencies they like,
  feature we had with .fixtures.yaml.

Also add 'r10k' to Gemfile.

That way, we will be able to use zuul dependencies and run tests accross
modules like we do with functional testing.

Depends-On: If47bf18b941754faacb1af37896b57e1dac035df
Change-Id: I5177b5360811499fbffb120a0f63e94d999710f3

commit_message:
spec: drop ::foo fake module

Stop using ::foo as a fake module and use a real module that is
installed in Puppet OpenStack Puppetfile.

Change-Id: I4027edd7a012158b830878b92783eaef4bf9bfdc
(cherry picked from commit f1e409ea7e1e6a33be56fa176ca156c498741888)

commit_message:
Update README.rst to include upstream planning etherpad

Small updates to the README, including adding instructions on how to
generate a `config.json` using stackviz-export and local subunit+dstat
files. Also includes a link to the upstream planning etherpad, which
will be used for ideas about getting StackViz working with data from
devstack-gate runs.

Change-Id: I206cb5ea6331eaf005b8c9c43a1e7b93e2d77a92

commit_message:
Fix cinder default log_dir

With the os_service_default updates, we introduced a regression since
the default log_dir needs to be specified if we want logs. Previously it
was defined as /var/log/cinder so this change adds it back in.

Change-Id: I51c3cb7be8c62cba3b9dbca292a7bb73d9a658b2

commit_message:
Fix simple-init install type flag

The install-type element is controlled by the
DIB_INSTALLTYPE_* flag[1], not DIB_INSTALL_TYPE. This patch fixes the
variable name so that we really are installing glean from the git
repository and not from pip.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/diskimage-builder/elements/install-types/README.html#environment-variables

Change-Id: I634706f421fbcf3edf1ae9d18a75e2cb9659eefe

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-06 20:59:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Ensure to decode bytes or fail

The commit 048316e98114145ad19285cdeedd0040b59a66f8 introduces the
pattern:

  if isinstance(line, bytes):
    try:
      line = line.decode(encoding='utf-8')
    except UnicodeError:
      pass
  # concat line with a string

which is not working in PY3K if an UnicodeError is raised because line
is not decoded and concatened to a string.

This change delegates decoding to safe_decode[1] which returns a text
object or raises an error.

[1] oslo_utils.encodeutils

Closes-Bug: #1503415
Blueprint: neutron-python3
Change-Id: I16b8013f33aa3efad65be8040d3210120e047bbd

commit_message:
Ensure to decode bytes or fail

The commit 048316e98114145ad19285cdeedd0040b59a66f8 introduces the
pattern:

  if isinstance(line, bytes):
    try:
      line = line.decode(encoding='utf-8')
    except UnicodeError:
      pass
  # concat line with a string

which is not working in PY3K if an UnicodeError is raised because line
is (silently) not decoded and concatened to a string.

This change ensures to return a text object or to raise an error.

Closes-Bug: #1503415
Blueprint: neutron-python3

commit_message:
Remove default=None for configuration bindings

The default value for a configuration variable is None. There is
no need to specifically set these as None.

The line where this is done is:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.config/blob/master/oslo_config/cfg.py#L684

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Iedf29b13d69ea9f2eb4d5aa746d7c1da8d83bafc

commit_message:
Force set network gateway in murano job-template

- Add KEEP_LOCALRC flag into murano job template to
set some variables during deployment.
- Force set network gateway, because it wasn't
setted by DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON.
- Force disable n-net because it wasn't disabled by
DEVSTACK_GATE_NEUTRON.

Change-Id: I708f043564fd792fee494053fe8594e288a5582d

subject: VPNaaS: Remove unneeded test
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 12:50:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/db/vpn/test_vpn_db.py'], 'message': 'VPNaaS: Remove unneeded test

Endpoint groups for VPN, use subnet CIDRs for local endpoints. This test
was added to address the case where a subnet is modified, while being
used by an endpoint group.

However, further investigation indicates that the the subnet CIDR field
is read-only, so it cannot be updated, when in use by an endpoint group.

As a result, this test case is not needed.

Change-Id: I87262949d0e49d42346fae04ab7f6fb989845c47
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: Remove unneeded test

Endpoint groups for VPN, use subnet CIDRs for local endpoints. This test
was added to address the case where a subnet is modified, while being
used by an endpoint group.

However, further investigation indicates that the the subnet CIDR field
is read-only, so it cannot be updated, when in use by an endpoint group.

As a result, this test case is not needed.

Change-Id: I87262949d0e49d42346fae04ab7f6fb989845c47

commit_message:
Don't assume the order of endpoints on get is the same as on create

We don't and should not enforce the order, so enhance the test not to
assume it.

Change-Id: I9dcc13e541963298aaad4882d2dff6e65c789e24
Closes-Bug: #1506482

subject: [contirbutor guide] Amend "word choice" table
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 13:20:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': '[contirbutor guide] Amend "word choice" table

This patch:

1. Corrects a typo in the word "host name" (according to IBM
   Terminology).
2. Removes "open-launch" and "start-execute" examples, as both words
   can be used depending on context.
3. Adds the word "setup" as a noun for consistency with other
   verb-noun pairs.

Change-Id: Ie167015f7f1800edda21cde082d2c30f15253ceb
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-11-05 14:22:12.000000000', 'files': ['doc/contributor-guide/source/writing-style/word-choice.rst'], 'message': '[contirbutor guide] Amend "word choice" table

This patch:

1. Corrects a typo in the word "host name" (according to IBM
   Terminology).
2. Removes "open-launch" example, as both words can be used
   depending on context.
3. Changes the synonyms for the word "execute" and adds a
   small explanation for its usage.
4. Adds the word "setup" as a noun for consistency with other
   verb-noun pairs.

Change-Id: Ie167015f7f1800edda21cde082d2c30f15253ceb
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
[contirbutor guide] Amend "word choice" table

This patch:

1. Corrects a typo in the word "host name" (according to IBM
   Terminology).
2. Removes "open-launch" example, as both words can be used
   depending on context.
3. Changes the synonyms for the word "execute" and adds a
   small explanation for its usage.
4. Adds the word "setup" as a noun for consistency with other
   verb-noun pairs.

Change-Id: Ie167015f7f1800edda21cde082d2c30f15253ceb

commit_message:
timeutils.utcnow should be used instead of datetime.datetime.utcnow

Developer should use timeutils.utcnow to replace the
datetime.datetime.utcnow.

Closes-Bug: #1513308

commit_message:
Fix unit tests according to fallback for openrc file

If "#{home}/openrc" file is not found the default fallback is
'/root/openrc' which shouldn't exist in this test case as well.

Closes-bug: #1513533

Change-Id: Icba36342cba345484e165c85835325949c6e1281

commit_message:
Fix error message for invalid CSAR URLs

Fix the error reported when the CSAR referenced by URL is not
valid. And add a test case to verify the fix.

Change-Id: I2d85e449e3f46f5ce57d748b51d25c1c69128169
Closes-Bug: #1502967

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-14 12:47:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Optional shared storage flag in evacuate API

Today evacuate API expects a onSharedStorage flag to be provided by the admin
however this information can be detected by the virt driver as well. To ease
the work of the admin and to allow easier automation of the evacuation tasks
this spec propose to make the onSharedStorage flag optional in the API.
The behavior of the evacuate API will not change if the onShareStorage flag
is still provided by the caller.

APIImpact

bp optional-shared-storage-flag-in-evacuate-api

Change-Id: Id820af0d9b77d6ff51bf00542483057870691d7f

commit_message:
Remove shared storage flag in evacuate API

Today evacuate API expects a onSharedStorage flag to be provided by the admin
however this information can be detected by the virt driver as well. To ease
the work of the admin and to allow easier automation of the evacuation tasks
this spec proposes to remove the onSharedStorage flag from the API.

APIImpact

bp remove-shared-storage-flag-in-evacuate-api

Change-Id: Id820af0d9b77d6ff51bf00542483057870691d7f

commit_message:
Release 1.10.0 of os-client-config

Added methods to return Sessions and Client objects based on a given
config. Add Conoha public cloud. Reflect move of Auro to Neutron.
Moved vendor configs to json for easier sharing with other languages.

Requirements change bumping constraint:
https://review.openstack.org/242160

Change-Id: I0208feaeb0fc365d30c3fbed399b5c95e6d09ddd

commit_message:
Use versionadded and versionchanged in doc

Document in which version new types and functions were added using
".. versionadded:: x.y". Document changes using
".. versionchanged:: x.y."

For watchdog module, add the versionadded tag in the module top
docstring, not on each type/function.

Add docstring to ssh_execute().

I used "git blame" + "git tag --contains=SHA1" to find these version,
and then I checked manually each version.

Change-Id: I56a7d8a4335833e9b49eedab026d20adfeedf942

commit_message:
Add missing @ngInject

There were a few place where we forgot to include the @ngInject
annotation. Without it the minification tool just mess with the
parameters.

Change-Id: I83f970885babce1e2254b050ee9839c8ec4df723

[{'created': '2015-08-27 17:00:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Remove reservation_id from the logs when a schedule fails

As discussed, reservation_id is a compatible layer for EC2 and thus is persisted,
but there are no filters which are using it. Since there are very little benefits
of giving it to the operator (because the operator can find a request by other ways)
and since it would mean we should persist that too in the RequestSpec object,
we prefer to remove that from the log information exposed to the operator.

commit_message:
Remove reservation_id from the logs when a schedule fails

As discussed, reservation_id is a compatible layer for EC2 and thus is persisted,
but there are no filters which are using it. Since there are very little benefits
of giving it to the operator (because the operator can find a request by other ways)
and since it would mean we should persist that too in the RequestSpec object,
we prefer to remove that from the log information exposed to the operator.

Change-Id: Ie8f050a1b3653fe1a6d901b3e4020158d63b9b8a
Partially-Implements: blueprint request-spec-object-mitaka

commit_message:
Pass both auth_uri and identity_uri for Neutron

auth_uri parameter is required along with identity_uri if authentication scheme
without keystone plugins is used

Closes-bug: #1503725
Change-Id: I83850bfe8d422b4ad93e58852524cdb114fcf326

commit_message:
Allow owner to be set on image create

This change means that on an image create a admin can set the owner
for the image. I believe this was accidently missed as the owner can be
changed in other ways (and there is a command for it in glance client).

Change-Id: I8d572a070bbb04dccdd051b8e0ad199c5754746e
Closes-bug: 1499368

commit_message:
Remove another extraneous get for create_server

The pattern of doing a get after a create is one we've been doing in
Infra for quite a while. However, if we're going to spin off a wait
loop, there is no need for this get, as the only thing we need in the
loop is the server id - which we already have. OTOH, if we're not going
to wait, this is still a useful get to do. Lucky for us, python has a
feature know as "if" which makes expressing this easy.

Change-Id: Ida354fb8fc772325a2fcf8e4ef1dcf3841176e2b

commit_message:
Introduce tempest-lib to functional tests

Functional test environment uses ironicclient api directly(client managers),
this approach has some cons - it doesn't include cli code. So it would be
better to use tempest-lib for this. It makes call to ironic with Popen,
and has parsing tools.

This change doesn't add new test cases, some helper methods have been added.

blueprint ironicclient-functional-tests

Change-Id: Iee426c65ee227e8b7c32ac94f6cfc1001f94e112

commit_message:
Restrict requests to fedora

The os_RELEASE for RHEL is 7.1 (for example). Which does not work for comparisons
to an integer.  And, while I am at it, change base_path to not use a hard-coded
directory.

Change-Id: I64a04810cc7ba4668c2cb7a8df79c206301e9e16

[{'created': '2015-10-22 23:03:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Evaluate SubAlarms immediately if possible

Most SubAlarm expressions can be evaluated immediately. If the
expression is MAX(m) > 10, a single value of m > 10 will cause the
SubAlarm to transition to the ALARM state regardless of any other
value of m that is recieved. Same is true of MIN. COUNT can be
evaluated immediately if the operator is > or >=. AVG and SUM
can't be evaluated until the end of the evaluation window since
the value could go up or down depending on the values received.

Also see if the sliding window for a SubAlarm can be slid when a
metric is received for the SubAlarm. This could allow the SubAlarm
to be evaluated faster than waiting for the tick tuple since that
is only received every 60 seconds.

commit_message:
Evaluate SubAlarms immediately if possible

Some SubAlarm expressions can be evaluated immediately. If the
expression is MAX(m) > 10, a single measurement of m > 10 will cause
the SubAlarm to transition to the ALARM state regardless of any other
measurement of m that is received. However if the operater is < or <=,
MAX can't be immediately evaluated since a following measurement
could be larger than the one storeed.  COUNT also can be evaluated
immediately if the operator is > or >= since it never decreases. MIN
is the opposite and can be immediately evaluated if the operator is
< or <=. AVG and SUM can't be evaluated until the end of the
evaluation window since the average or sum could go up or down
depending on the measurements received and whether or not they are
negative.

Also see if the sliding window for a SubAlarm can be slid when a
metric is received for the SubAlarm. This could allow the SubAlarm
to be evaluated faster than waiting for the tick tuple since that
is only received every 60 seconds.

Add unit tests for immediate SubAlarm evaluation.

Add unit tests for previously untested parts of SubAlarmStats

Change-Id: I989a82328fa4ccc04b49d203f70a1adc9fa4d3bb

commit_message:
Don't assume pass_version_arg=False for network

Excitingly, one of the places where we hard-code a workaround for
a differently behaving client is not needed. The Client in neutron
that takes a version arg is in neutronclient.neutron.client. Also,
pass the version arg as positional when we pass it, as some of the
clients (neutron) require it, and all accept it.

Change-Id: Ifcbaab782173b95a678af0b2792a1194b198b687

subject: Use assertIn and assertNotIn
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-26 12:09:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: I38bf94b50dbfff8aa075b8ecbb5b4d03a2cdf2e2
Related-Bug: #1510007
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-10-26 19:58:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use assertIn and assertNotIn

commit_message:
Use assertIn and assertNotIn

Tests should use:
  self.assertIn(value, list)
  self.assertNotIn(value, list)

instead of:
  self.assertTrue(value in list)
  self.assertFalse(value in list)

because assertIn and assertNotIn raise more meaningful errors:
  self.assertIn(3, [1, 2]
  >>> MismatchError: 3 not in [1, 2]

  self.assertTrue(3 in [1, 2])
  >>> AssertionError: False is not true

Change-Id: I38bf94b50dbfff8aa075b8ecbb5b4d03a2cdf2e2
Closes-Bug: #1510007

commit_message:
Add network templates for multiple NIC configuration

This change adds a set of network interface configurations for use
with network isolation. The multiple-nics templates includes one
separate NIC per network, and assumes that nic1 is used for the
provisioning network (ctlplane). Also included is an environment
file for including the multiple-nics configuration in a deployment.

This revision changes the ordering of the NICs. By doing that, it
is possible to wire up only a subset of the NICs for the storage
nodes, and it is possilbe to leave the External NIC only configured
on the controllers.

rdo: Updated this commit for static control plane configuration

Co-Authored-By: Rhys Oxenham <roxenham@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic878d1ed1a85b5705295d087a743570ca8213504

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-17 08:46:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Factorize yaml loading of declarative stuffs

This change continues to remove code duplication by factorizing the
yaml file loading.

This also homogenizes the error handling.
The precision of error message will be the same for all.
When the yaml file is incorrectly formatted, we now raise an exception,
instead of sometimes raising and sometimes loading an empty definitions,
that can generated an unwanted behavior of collector and notification agents.

commit_message:
Factorize yaml loading of declarative stuffs

This change continues to remove code duplication by factorizing the
yaml file loading.

This also homogenizes the error handling.
The precision of error message will be the same for all.
When the yaml file is incorrectly formatted, we now raise an exception,
instead of sometimes raising and sometimes loading an empty definitions,
that can generated an unwanted behavior of collector and notification agents.

Change-Id: I9ae8f519472f1ae2a14e61028a427ba6f3b0d1f3

subject: Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 15:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['docker/keystone/extend_start.sh'], 'message': "Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros

In some cases we're seeing httpd not cleaning up properly after itself,
which results in the keystone container failing to restart. This is
confirmed to happen on rpm based distros, but have not had any reports
on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I58b006189e700f1c851601b4f64dd0fae931103c
Closes-Bug: #1489676
Co-Authored-By: Tim Potter <tpot@hpe.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7df3a0bea56f654a3d65da27c0e783f775b4ed18)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Clean up keystone httpd pid files for RPM distros

In some cases we're seeing httpd not cleaning up properly after itself,
which results in the keystone container failing to restart. This is
confirmed to happen on rpm based distros, but have not had any reports
on Ubuntu.

Change-Id: I58b006189e700f1c851601b4f64dd0fae931103c
Closes-Bug: #1489676
Co-Authored-By: Tim Potter <tpot@hpe.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7df3a0bea56f654a3d65da27c0e783f775b4ed18)

commit_message:
Support testing of multiple local subnets

Modify the functional test to support IPSec connections with multiple
local subnets. In addition, refactor the tests, to better reuse code and
cleanup HA support. Pushed the code for setting up the tests into helper
methods/classes.

Change-Id: Ifb54a6d8da89ddabefc7e1871f09bcb6207e16dd
Closes-Bug: #1505799
Depends-On: I7a011e3170d7db463a6561e550b2ead3e3311125

subject: Added support of regexp patterns for groups in deployment_tasks.yaml
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 15:47:25.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_graph.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_graph_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Added support of regexp patterns for groups in deployment_tasks.yaml

Regular expressions (perl format) should be used to specify wildcard.
groups: .* # any group
groups: "^(?!mongo$)" # all groups except mongo
groups: (?=mongo)(?=^((?!^primary).)*$) #all mongo, except primary-mongo
groups: "mongo|astute" # mongo or astute

Closes-Bug: #1480930

Change-Id: Id7c2e4de79884789963b4523cb66630afcb33d1d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Added support of regexp patterns for groups in deployment_tasks.yaml

Regular expressions (perl format) should be used to specify wildcard.
groups: .* # any group
groups: "^(?!mongo$)" # all groups except mongo
groups: (?=mongo)(?=^((?!^primary).)*$) #all mongo, except primary-mongo
groups: "mongo|astute" # mongo or astute

Closes-Bug: #1480930

Change-Id: Id7c2e4de79884789963b4523cb66630afcb33d1d

commit_message:
Set ERROR_ON_CLONE=False.

The use of the git_clone function in commit
42287ef16ddfb70ff8ccfec6c94677e52863c8d7 caused a regression in our
tempest job.  It now fails when trying to clone ovs.

Change-Id: If021941530dae0f42e36b8c3ebb2d2e4fa0ad60b
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

subject: Alembic update/cleanup
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-05 14:31:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of
  shipping our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added as a
dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron
repo for each test run)

commit_message:
Alembic update/cleanup

This change updates and cleans up our alembic migration code:
- we now use an alembic migration entry point, instead of
  shipping our own db management tool
- use expand/contract alembic branches
- downgrade is not supported anymore, and we had none, drop it

To allow testing the migration scripts, Neutron is added as a
dependency for tests (in way that avoids cloning the neutron
repo for each test run)

Pseudo cherry-pick of Ib122895e0a5b07eb1e7b1ec04233c49e95389476

Change-Id: If7ec84af71fd385359b0a68dac9f0563d8f1bf04

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-07-18 02:47:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Encrypting/Decrypting object metadata

This is just one of what will be several reviews
for the encryption-at-rest feature in swift.
patch 157907 contains a prototype of the feature.
See spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Adds the encryption and decryption of object metadata.
Specifically the user-metadata, content-type, and the etag.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
This commit message will be updated with a vagrant setup when
one becomes available.  Until then, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

Currently, the functests have 8 errors and 17 failures.  These
are all due to not having COPY implemented, and not having a good
solution for handling conditional GET.

Change-Id: I194e2329992232499bcca06f48431e7c09b623ed

commit_message:
Encrypting/Decrypting object metadata

See encryption spec in_progress/at_rest_encryption.html

Adds the encryption and decryption of object metadata.
Specifically the user-metadata, content-type, and the etag.

Depends on having keymaster middleware and cryptography module.
You can point the following vagrant to this patch:
https://github.com/swiftstack/vagrant-swift-all-in-one/tree/crypto
Alternatively, please follow the instructions
in the proxy-server.conf-sample.  You will also need to add the
fake_footers middleware as well to get the correct functionality.

After this change, the functests have 6 errors and 17 failures.  These
are due to not yet having container listings updated, COPY implemented,
and not having a solution for handling conditional GET.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hp.com>

Change-Id: I194e2329992232499bcca06f48431e7c09b623ed

commit_message:
Update network api version in defaults.json

neutronclient expects 2.0, not 2 - but we'd not noticed because all
of the consumption of client constructors were bypasing the version
arg for neutron. In a follow-up patch we'll fix that, but the
value in defaults.json is just straight wrong.

Change-Id: I684c4ef063193355c6cf936d4f18576db919762b

commit_message:
Dont turn bools into strings

It turns out that requests does not like that.

Change-Id: I206be8107f5cfaaa7dc7f34ab0b0764e0dc3fb0d

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-01 09:48:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Provide an error message on bogus config file spec

If local.conf specifies a config file addition in the following way...

[[post-config|$MY_CONF_FILE]]
[xyz]
foo=bar

...and $MY_CONF_FILE points to a file whose directory is not writable by
the user running the script, then stack.sh aborts with the following
obscure message:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.113 | touch: setting times of '/': Permission denied

This patch modifies inc/meta-config to provide a useful error message,
such as:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.114 | could not create config file / ($MY_CONF_FILE)

This patch also modifies inc/meta-config so that it provides an error
message if $MY_CONF_FILE is empty (instead of silently ignoring this local.conf
statement):

  2015-09-01 09:38:53.406 | bogus config file specification: $MY_CONF_FILE
  is undefined

Change-Id: I9b78407420318548561012a8672762bc7fdd6db6
Closes-Bug: 1470881

commit_message:
Provide an error message on bogus config file spec

If local.conf specifies a config file addition in the following way...

[[post-config|$MY_CONF_FILE]]
[xyz]
foo=bar

...and $MY_CONF_FILE points to a file whose directory is not writable by
the user running the script, then stack.sh aborts with the following
obscure message:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.113 | touch: setting times of '/': Permission denied

This patch modifies inc/meta-config to provide a useful error message,
such as:

  2015-09-01 08:20:08.114 | could not create config file / ($MY_CONF_FILE)

This patch also modifies inc/meta-config so that it provides an error
message if $MY_CONF_FILE is empty (instead of silently ignoring this local.conf
statement):

  2015-09-01 09:38:53.406 | bogus config file specification: $MY_CONF_FILE
  is undefined

Change-Id: I9b78407420318548561012a8672762bc7fdd6db6
Closes-Bug: 1490881

subject: liberty: release python-novaclient 2.30.2
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-29 14:43:00.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/liberty/python-novaclient.yaml'], 'message': 'liberty: release python-novaclient 2.30.2

This is a patch release request for a high priority bug fix where users
could request, by default, nova API microversions that the client does
not yet support which leads to failures.

Changes since 2.30.1:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.30.1..
dc49707 Set DEFAULT_OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION to 2.5

Related-Bug: #1500688

Change-Id: Ide392b3a226d2f174e9b3627dbe183f5ff504f19
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
liberty: release python-novaclient 2.30.2

This is a patch release request for a high priority bug fix where users
could request, by default, nova API microversions that the client does
not yet support which leads to failures.

Changes since 2.30.1:

mriedem@ubuntu:~/git/python-novaclient$ git log --oneline --no-merges
2.30.1..
dc49707 Set DEFAULT_OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION to 2.5

Related-Bug: #1500688

Change-Id: Ide392b3a226d2f174e9b3627dbe183f5ff504f19

Currently nova allows the caller to specify "min_count" and "max_count"

Currently there is no good way for an end user to get information about how

commit_message:
Drop support for booting multiple instances

Currently nova allows the caller to specify "min_count" and "max_count"
parameters in order to cause multiple instances to be booted in one call.
Currently there is no good way for an end user to get information about how
many instances were successfully booted, and if so which ones were booted as a
result of that call. Since we now have orchestration outside of nova which does
a better job of keeping track of that sort of thing, let's drop support for
booting multiple instances from nova.

APIImpact
Implements blueprint no-multiple-instance-boot

Change-Id: I7bdd2324a958d550f964479790b2a22c1941c0cc

commit_message:
XtremIO fix create CG from src flow

Fix a bug suring creating volume with CG,
    that prevented the volume from being added to the CG on the array.
Query array snapshots names for CG snapshot before copying them
    to a new volume.
Add unittest for create_cg_from_src.

liberty-backport-potential

Change-Id: Ida6eb3f7198f7050d8c27fe5560ac8980bb4f0df
Closes-Bug: #1512682

subject: Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-16 20:28:19.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py'], 'message': 'Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2
(cherry picked from commit 94904b305b74e4e9e1b70b7c6e1351febdd6862d)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Rename fernet methods to match expiration timestamp

Fernet tokens carry the token creation time as part of the Fernet
specification, which is an integer. This is not the case with the token
expiration time, which is carried in the payload of the Fernet token. Keystone
converts the timestamp to a floating point value to save space in the token.
Previously, all the methods handling this conversion, along with the related
tests, communicated that this conversion was to an integer instead of a
float. This change corrects the methods signatures in the Fernet token provider
to be consistent with the timestamp type that is used in the implementation.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/token_formatters.py

Change-Id: Ibea9fa0d546948501ebcd9f9f826b1f1319246f2
(cherry picked from commit 94904b305b74e4e9e1b70b7c6e1351febdd6862d)

commit_message:
Log end of router updates for PD and delete branches

These execution branches call continue directly without
logging the end of the router update.  This leads to
confusion about when the last router update finishes if
it is a delete or a PD update.

Change-Id: Id82e7374aa9336e0adea3042238f30f716208373
Signed-off-by: Ryan Moats <rmoats@us.ibm.com>
Closes-bug: #1511004
(cherry picked from commit 70b3d383ac2a0d7d339c551065b9b378a4b9b914)
